Job 3:9	Let the stars be concealed with its darkness. Let it expect light, and not see it, nor the rising of the dawn in the East.
Job 3:10	For it did not close the doors of the womb that bore me, nor take away evils from my eyes.
Job 3:11	Why did I not die in the womb? Having left the womb, why did I not immediately perish?
Job 3:12	Why was I received upon the knees? Why was I suckled at the breasts?
Job 3:13	For by now, I should have been sleeping silently, and taking rest in my sleep
Job 3:14	with the kings and consuls of the earth, who build themselves solitudes,
Job 3:15	either with princes, who possess gold and fill their houses with silver,
Job 3:16	or, like a hidden miscarriage, I should not have continued, just like those who, being conceived, have not seen the light.
Job 3:17	There the impious cease from rebellion, and there the wearied in strength take rest.
Job 3:18	And at such times, having been bound together without difficulty, they have not heard the voice of the bailiff.
Job 3:19	The small and great are there, and the servant is free from his master.
Job 3:20	Why is light given to the miserable, and life to those who are in bitterness of soul,
Job 3:21	who expect death, and it does not arrive, like those who dig for treasure
Job 3:22	and who rejoice greatly when they have found the grave,
Job 3:23	to a man whose way is hidden and whom God has surrounded with darkness?
Job 3:24	Before I eat, I sigh; and like overflowing waters, so is my howl,
Job 3:25	for the terror that I feared has happened to me, and so has the dread befallen me.
Job 3:26	Have I not remained hidden? Have I not kept silence? Have I not remained calm? Yet indignation has overcome me.
Job 4:1	But Eliphaz the Themanite, answering, said:
Job 4:2	If we start to speak to you, perhaps you will take it badly, but who can hold back the words he has conceived?
Job 4:3	Behold, you have taught many, and you have strengthened weary hands.
Job 4:4	Your words have reassured the wavering, and you have fortified the trembling knees.
Job 4:5	But now the scourge has overcome you, and you falter. It has touched you, and you are disturbed.
Job 4:6	Where is your reverence, your fortitude, your patience, and the perfection of your ways?
Job 4:7	Consider this, I beg you: who ever perished being innocent? Or when have the righteous been destroyed?
Job 4:8	In fact, I have instead seen those who work iniquity and who sow resentments, reap them,
Job 4:9	perishing by the breath of God, and being consumed by the wrath of his spirit.
Job 4:10	The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the lioness, and the teeth of young lions have been worn away.
Job 4:11	The tiger has perished because it does not have prey, and the young lions have been scattered.
Job 4:12	Furthermore, a word was spoken to me in secret, and, as if by theft, my ears received the pulse of its whisper.
Job 4:13	In the horror of a vision by night, when men are accustomed to be overtaken by a deep sleep,
Job 4:14	fear and trembling seized me and all my bones were terrified.
Job 4:15	And when a spirit passed before me, the hair on my body stood up.
Job 4:16	There appeared an image before my eyes, someone whose face I did not recognize, and I heard a voice like a gentle breeze.
Job 4:17	Should man be justified in relation to God, or will a man be more pure than his Maker?
Job 4:18	Behold, those who serve him are not steadfast, and in his angels he finds imperfection.
Job 4:19	How much more will those who live in houses of clay, which have an earthly foundation, be consumed like the moth?
Job 4:20	From morning all the way to evening, they will be cut down, and because no one understands, they will be destroyed without ceasing.
Job 4:21	But those who are left behind will be taken away from them; they will die, and not in wisdom.
Job 5:1	Therefore call, if there are any who will respond to you, and turn to one or another of the saints.
Job 5:2	Truly, anger condemns the foolish to death, and envy kills the petty.
Job 5:3	I have seen a fool with a strong root, and I have cursed his excellence without hesitation.
Job 5:4	His sons will be far from prosperity and will be crushed at the gate, and there will be none who can rescue them.
Job 5:5	Their harvest, the starving will eat. The armed man will rob him, and the thirsty will drink his resources.
Job 5:6	Nothing on earth occurs without a reason, and sorrow does not rise from the earth.
Job 5:7	Man is born to labor, and the bird to fly.
Job 5:8	Therefore, because of this, I will beg the Lord, and place my eloquence before God.
Job 5:9	He does great and unfathomable and miraculous things without number.
Job 5:10	He gives rain over the face of the earth and irrigates all things with the waters.
Job 5:11	He places the humble on high and encourages the grieving towards health.
Job 5:12	He dispels the thoughts of the spiteful, lest their hands be able to complete what they had begun.
Job 5:13	He catches the wise in their cleverness and dissipates the counsel of the perverse.
Job 5:14	They will encounter darkness in the daytime, and they will grope at midday just as in the night.
Job 5:15	Thereafter, he will act to save the needy from the sword of their mouth, and the poor from the hand of the violent.
Job 5:16	And there will be hope for those in need, for iniquity will diminish its speech.
Job 5:17	Blessed is the man whom God corrects; therefore, do not reject the chastisement of the Lord.
Job 5:18	For he wounds and he cures; he strikes and his hands will heal.
Job 5:19	He will deliver you into six tribulations, and in the seventh, evil will not touch you.
Job 5:20	During famine, he will rescue you from death, and during war, from the hand of the sword.
Job 5:21	You will be hidden from the scourge of the tongue, and you will not fear calamity when it arrives.
Job 5:22	In desolation and in famine, you will laugh, and you will not dread the beasts of the earth.
Job 5:23	For you are in harmony with the stones of the land, and the beasts of the earth will make peace with you.
Job 5:24	And you will know that your home has peace, and, concerning your appearance, you will not sin.
Job 5:25	Likewise, you will know that your offspring will be manifold and your progeny will be like the grass of the earth.
Job 5:26	You will enter the grave with abundance, just as a crop of wheat is gathered in its time.
Job 5:27	Behold, this is just as we have found it, which you have heard; walk it through your mind.
Job 6:1	But Job, responding, said:
Job 6:2	I wish that my sins, for which I deserve wrath, and the calamity that I endure, were weighed out on a balance.
Job 6:3	Compared to the sand of the sea, they would appear heavier, and so my words are full of sorrow.
Job 6:4	For the arrows of the Lord are in me, my spirit drinks of their indignation, and the terrors of the Lord are soldiers against me.
Job 6:5	Will the wild ass bray when he has grass? Or will the ox bellow when he stands before a full manger?
Job 6:6	Or can one eat bland food, which is not seasoned with salt? Or can anyone taste that which, if tasted, causes death?
Job 6:7	The things that my soul was unwilling to touch before, now, because of anguish, are my foods.
Job 6:8	Who will grant that my petition may arrive and that God may bestow on me what I expect,
Job 6:9	and that he who, at first, had crushed me, will let loose his hand and cut me down?
Job 6:10	And may this be my consolation, that in afflicting me with sorrow, although he might not be lenient with me, I still do not contradict the words of the Holy One.
Job 6:11	For what is my strength, that I may continue? Or what is my goal, so that I may act patiently?
Job 6:12	My strength is not the strength of stones, nor is my flesh made of bronze.
Job 6:13	Behold, there is no help for me in myself, and my loved ones also have withdrawn from me.
Job 6:14	He who takes away mercy from his friend, abandons the fear of the Lord.
Job 6:15	My brethren have disregarded me, like a torrent that passes swiftly through the steep valleys.
Job 6:16	Those who fear frost, snow will rush over them.
Job 6:17	At that time, when they are scattered, they will perish, and when it becomes hot, they will be freed from their place.
Job 6:18	The paths of their steps are entangled; they will walk in vain and will perish.
Job 6:19	Consider the paths of Thema, the ways of Saba, and wait a little while.
Job 6:20	They have been thrown into confusion, just as I had hoped; they have even come to me and are overwhelmed with shame.
Job 6:21	Now you have arrived, and merely by seeing my affliction, you are afraid.
Job 6:22	Did I say: “Bring to me and give to me from your necessities?”
Job 6:23	or, “Free me from the hand of the enemy and rescue me from the hand of the strong?”
Job 6:24	Teach me, and I will be silent, and if by chance I have been ignorant of anything, instruct me.
Job 6:25	Why have you diminished the words of truth, when there is none of you who is able to offer proof against me?
Job 6:26	You prepare speeches as so much noise, and you offer words into the wind.
Job 6:27	You encroach upon the orphan, and you strive to undermine your friend.
Job 6:28	Such is true, so finish what you have begun. Listen closely, and see if I lie.
Job 6:29	Respond, I beg you, without contention, and, speaking what is just, pass judgment.
Job 6:30	And you will not find iniquity on my tongue, nor will foolishness resound in my throat.
Job 7:1	The life of a man on the earth is a battle, and his days are like the days of a hired hand.
Job 7:2	Just as a servant desires the shade, and just as the hired hand looks forward to the end of his work,
Job 7:3	so also have I had empty months and have counted my burdensome nights.
Job 7:4	If I lie down to sleep, I will say, “When will I rise?” And next I will hope for the evening and will be filled with sorrows even until darkness.
Job 7:5	My flesh is clothed with particles of rottenness and filth; my skin is dried up and tightened.
Job 7:6	My days have passed by more quickly than threads are cut by a weaver, and they have been consumed without any hope.
Job 7:7	Remember that my life is wind, and my eye will not return to see good things.
Job 7:8	Neither will the sight of man gaze upon me; your eyes are upon me, and I will not endure.
Job 7:9	Just as a cloud is consumed and passes away, so he who descends to hell will not ascend.
Job 7:10	He will not return again to his house, nor will his own place know him any longer.
Job 7:11	And because of this, I will not restrain my mouth. I will speak in the affliction of my spirit. I will converse from the bitterness of my soul.
Job 7:12	Am I an ocean or a whale, that you have encircled me in a prison?
Job 7:13	If I say, “My bed will comfort me, and I will find rest, speaking with myself on my blanket,”
Job 7:14	then you will frighten me with dreams, and strike dread through visions,
Job 7:15	so that, because of these things, my soul would choose hanging, and my bones, death.
Job 7:16	I despair; by no means will I live any longer. Spare me, for my days are nothing.
Job 7:17	What is man, that you should praise him? Or why do you place your heart near him?
Job 7:18	You visit him at dawn, and you test him unexpectedly.
Job 7:19	How long will you not spare me, nor release me to ingest my saliva?
Job 7:20	I have sinned; what should I do for you, O keeper of men? Why have you set me against you, so that I have become burdensome even to myself?
Job 7:21	Why do you not steal away my sin, and why do you not sweep away my iniquity? Behold, now I will sleep in the dust, and if you seek me in the morning, I will not remain.
Job 8:1	But Baldad the Suhite, responding, said:
Job 8:2	How long will you speak this way, so that the words of your mouth are like a changeable wind?
Job 8:3	Does God supplant judgment, or does the Almighty subvert that which is just?
Job 8:4	And if now your children have sinned against him, and he has dismissed them into the power of their iniquity,
Job 8:5	even so, you should arise early to God, so as to beseech the Almighty.
Job 8:6	If you approach with purity and honesty, he will quickly be attentive to you, and a peaceful life will repay your righteousness,
Job 8:7	so much so that, if your former things were small, your latter things would be multiplied greatly.
Job 8:8	For inquire of the earliest generation, and investigate diligently the history of the fathers,
Job 8:9	(of course, we are but of yesterday and are ignorant that our days on earth are like a shadow,)
Job 8:10	and they will teach you; they will speak with you and will offer you the eloquence of their hearts.
Job 8:11	Can the marsh plant live without moisture? Or can sedges grow without water?
Job 8:12	When it is still in flower, and has not been pulled up by hand, it withers before all other plants.
Job 8:13	Just so are the ways of all who forget God, and the hope of the hypocrite will perish.
Job 8:14	His frenzy will not please him, and his faith will be like a spider’s web.
Job 8:15	He will lean on his house, and it will not stand; he will prop it up, but it will not rise.
Job 8:16	He seems to have moisture before the sun arrives; and at sunrise, his sprout shoots forth.
Job 8:17	His roots will crowd together over a heap of stones, and among the stones he will remain.
Job 8:18	If someone is devoured right beside him, he will deny him and will say: “I do not know you.”
Job 8:19	For this is the benefit of his way, that others in turn may spring up from the earth.
Job 8:20	God will not discard the simple, nor will he extend his hand to the spiteful,
Job 8:21	even until your mouth is filled with laughter and your lips with rejoicing.
Job 8:22	Those who hate you, will be clothed with confusion, and the tabernacle of the impious will not continue.
Job 9:1	And Job, responding, said:
Job 9:2	Truly, I know that it is so, and that man cannot be justified compared with God.
Job 9:3	If he chooses to contend with him, he is not able to respond to him once out of a thousand times.
Job 9:4	He is understanding in heart and mighty in strength; who has resisted him and yet had peace?
Job 9:5	He has moved mountains, and those whom he overthrew in his fury did not know it.
Job 9:6	He shakes the earth out of its place and its pillars tremble.
Job 9:7	He commands the sun and it does not rise, and he closes the stars as if under a seal.
Job 9:8	He alone extends the heavens, and he walks upon the waves of the sea.
Job 9:9	He fashions Arcturus, and Orion, and Hyades, and the interior of the south.
Job 9:10	He accomplishes great and incomprehensible and miraculous things, which cannot be numbered.
Job 9:11	If he approaches me, I will not see him; if he departs, I will not understand.
Job 9:12	If he suddenly should question, who will answer him? Or who can say, “Why did you do so?”
Job 9:13	God, whose wrath no one is able to resist, and under whom they bend who carry the world,
Job 9:14	what am I then, that I should answer him and exchange words with him?
Job 9:15	And if I now have any justice, I will not respond, but will beseech my judge.
Job 9:16	And if he should listen to me when I call, I would not believe that he had heard my voice.
Job 9:17	For he will crush me in a whirlwind and multiply my wounds, even without cause.
Job 9:18	He does not permit my spirit to rest, and he fills me with bitterness.
Job 9:19	If strength is sought, he is most strong; if equity in judgment, no one would dare to give testimony for me.
Job 9:20	If I wanted to justify myself, my own mouth will condemn me; if I would reveal my innocence, he would prove me depraved.
Job 9:21	And if I now became simple, my soul would be ignorant even of this, and my life would weary me.
Job 9:22	There is one thing that I have said: both the innocent and the impious he consumes.
Job 9:23	If he scourges, let him kill all at once, and not laugh at the punishment of the innocent.
Job 9:24	Since the earth has been given into the hand of the impious, he covers the face of its judges; for if it is not him, then who is it?
Job 9:25	My days have been swifter than a messenger; they have fled and have not seen goodness.
Job 9:26	They have passed by like ships carrying fruits, just like an eagle flying to food.
Job 9:27	If I say: “By no means will I speak this way.” I change my face and I am tortured with sorrow.
Job 9:28	I have dreaded all my works, knowing that you did not spare the offender.
Job 9:29	Yet, if I am also just as impious, why have I labored in vain?
Job 9:30	If I had been washed with snow-like waters, and my hands were shining like the cleanest thing,
Job 9:31	yet you would plunge me in filth, and my own garments would abhor me.
Job 9:32	For even I would not answer a man who were like myself, nor one who could be heard with me equally in judgment.
Job 9:33	There is no one who could both prevail in argument and in placing his hand between the two.
Job 9:34	Let him take his staff away from me, and let not the fear of him terrify me.
Job 9:35	I will speak and I will not fear him, for in fearfulness I am not able to respond.
Job 10:1	My soul is weary of my life. I will release my words against myself. I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
Job 10:2	I will say to God: Do not be willing to condemn me. Reveal to me why you judge me this way.
Job 10:3	Does it seem good to you, if you find fault with me and oppress me, the work of your own hands, and assist the counsel of the impious?
Job 10:4	Do you have bodily eyes? Or, just as man sees, will you see?
Job 10:5	Are your days just like the days of man, and are your years as the times of humans,
Job 10:6	so that you would inquire about my iniquity and examine my sin?
Job 10:7	And you know that I have done nothing impious, yet there is no one who can deliver from your hand.
Job 10:8	Your hands have made me and formed me all around, and, in this way, do you suddenly throw me away?
Job 10:9	Remember, I ask you, that you have fashioned me like clay, and you will reduce me to dust.
Job 10:10	Have you not extracted me like milk and curdled me like cheese?
Job 10:11	You have clothed me with skin and flesh. You have put me together with bones and nerves.
Job 10:12	You have assigned to me life and mercy, and your visitation has preserved my spirit.
Job 10:13	Though you may conceal this in your heart, yet I know that you remember everything.
Job 10:14	If I have sinned, and you have spared me for an hour, why do you not endure me to be clean from my iniquity?
Job 10:15	And if I should be impious, woe to me, and if I should be just, I will not lift up my head, being drenched with affliction and misery.
Job 10:16	And because of pride, you will seize me like a lioness, and having returned, you torment me to an extraordinary degree.
Job 10:17	You renew your testimony against me, and you multiply your wrath against me, and these punishments make war within me.
Job 10:18	Why did you lead me out of the womb? If only I had been consumed, so that no eye would ever see me!
Job 10:19	I should have been as if I had not been: transferred from the womb to the tomb.
Job 10:20	Will not my few days be completed soon? Release me, therefore, so that I may lament my sorrows a little,
Job 10:21	before I depart and return no more to a land that is dark and covered with the fog of death,
Job 10:22	a land of misery and darkness, where the shadow of death, and nothing else but everlasting horror, dwells.
Job 11:1	But Zophar the Naamathite, responding, said:
Job 11:2	Will he who speaks much, not also listen? Or will a talkative man be justified?
Job 11:3	Will men be silent only for you? And when you have mocked others, will no one refute you?
Job 11:4	For you said: “My word is pure, and I am clean in your sight.”
Job 11:5	Yet I wish that God would speak with you, and would open his lips to you,
Job 11:6	so that he might reveal to you the secrets of wisdom, and how intricate his law is, and that you would understand how much less he requires of you than your iniquity deserves.
Job 11:7	By chance, will you comprehend the footsteps of God and reach all the way to the perfection of the Almighty?
Job 11:8	He is higher than heaven, and what will you do? He is deeper than hell, but how will you know?
Job 11:9	His measure is longer than the earth and wider than the sea.
Job 11:10	If he overturns all things, or packs them together, who will contradict him?
Job 11:11	For he knows the vanity of men, and when he sees iniquity, does he not evaluate it?
Job 11:12	A vain man is lifted up in arrogance, and he thinks that he is born free like a wild ass’s colt.
Job 11:13	But you have fortified your heart and extended your hands to him.
Job 11:14	If you would send away from you the iniquity that is in your hand, and not let injustice remain in your tabernacle,
Job 11:15	then you would be able to lift up your face without blemish, and you would be steadfast and unafraid.
Job 11:16	Misery, likewise, you would forget, or would remember only like waters that have passed by.
Job 11:17	And brightness, like that of midday, will rise upon you until evening, and when you would think yourself consumed, you will rise up like the morning star.
Job 11:18	And, when hope has been set before you, you will have faith, and, when buried, you will sleep secure.
Job 11:19	You will rest, and there will be nothing to make you afraid, and many will make requests before your face.
Job 11:20	But the eyes of the impious will fade away, and the path to escape will perish before them, for the abomination of the soul is their hope.
Job 12:1	Then Job, answering, said:
Job 12:2	Are you, therefore, alone among men, and will wisdom die with you?
Job 12:3	And I have a heart just as you also do, and I am not inferior to you. For who is ignorant of these things, which you know?
Job 12:4	He who is mocked by his friends as I am, will call upon God, and he will listen to him because it is the sincerity of the just that is being mocked.
Job 12:5	The lamp that is despised in the thoughts of the rich is ready for the appointed time.
Job 12:6	The tabernacles of robbers are numerous, and they provoke God boldly; whereas, it is he who has given all things into their hands.
Job 12:7	In truth, ask the mules, and they will teach you, and the birds of the sky, and they will reveal to you.
Job 12:8	Speak with the earth, and it will respond to you, and the fish of the sea will explain.
Job 12:9	Who is ignorant that the hand of the Lord has made all these things?
Job 12:10	In his hand is the soul of all the living and the spirit of all the flesh of mankind.
Job 12:11	Does not the ear perceive words, and the palate, when eating, perceive flavor?
Job 12:12	In old age is wisdom, and in length of days is prudence.
Job 12:13	With him is wisdom and strength, he has counsel and understanding.
Job 12:14	If he tears down, there is no one who can build up; if he encloses a man, there is no one who can open.
Job 12:15	If he restrains the waters, everything will dry up; and if he sends them forth, they will subdue the land.
Job 12:16	With him is strength and wisdom; he knows both the deceiver and he who is deceived.
Job 12:17	He leads advisors to a foolish end and judges to stupidity.
Job 12:18	He removes the belt of kings and encircles their waist with a rope.
Job 12:19	He leads away priests in dishonor and displaces nobles,
Job 12:20	altering the lips of those who speak the truth and sweeping away the teaching of the aged.
Job 12:21	He pours distain upon the leaders, relieving those who had been oppressed.
Job 12:22	He reveals the depths of the darkness, and he brings the shadow of death into the light.
Job 12:23	He multiplies peoples, and destroys them, and, having been overthrown, he restores them anew.
Job 12:24	He transforms the heart of the leaders of the people on earth, and misleads those who in vain advance upon the inviolable.
Job 12:25	They will grope as in the darkness, not the light, and he will make them stagger like drunkards.
Job 13:1	Behold, my eye has seen all these things, and my ear has heard, and I have understood each one.
Job 13:2	In conformity with your knowledge, I also know. I am not inferior to you.
Job 13:3	Yet I speak this way to the Almighty, and I desire to argue with God,
Job 13:4	having first shown that you fabricate lies and cultivate perverse teachings.
Job 13:5	And I wish that you would remain silent, so that you would be counted among the wise.
Job 13:6	Therefore, listen to my correction, and pay attention to the judgment of my lips.
Job 13:7	Does God require your lie, so that you would speak deceitfully for him?
Job 13:8	Have you taken his place, and do you struggle to give judgment in favor of God?
Job 13:9	Or, will it please him, from whom nothing can be concealed? Or, will he be deceived, like a man, by your deceitfulness?
Job 13:10	He will accuse you because in secret you have preempted his presence.
Job 13:11	As soon as he moves himself, he will disturb you, and his dread will fall over you.
Job 13:12	Your remembrance will be compared to ashes, and your necks will be reduced to clay.
Job 13:13	Be silent for a little while, so that I may speak whatever my mind suggests to me.
Job 13:14	Why do I wound my flesh with my teeth, and carry my soul in my hands?
Job 13:15	And now, if he would kill me, I will hope in him; in this, truly, I will correct my ways in his sight.
Job 13:16	And he will be my savior, for no hypocrite at all will approach in his sight.
Job 13:17	Listen to my words, and perceive an enigma with your ears.
Job 13:18	If I will be judged, I know that I will be found to be just.
Job 13:19	Who is it that will go to judgment with me? Let him approach. Why should I be consumed in silence?
Job 13:20	Do not do such things to me twice, and then I will not hide from your face.
Job 13:21	Take your hand far away from me, and do not let your dread terrify me.
Job 13:22	Call me, and I will answer you, or else I will speak, and you can answer me.
Job 13:23	How many iniquities and sins do I have? Reveal my crimes and offenses to me.
Job 13:24	Why do you conceal your face and consider me to be your enemy?
Job 13:25	Against a leaf, which is carried away by the wind, you reveal your power, and you pursue dry straw.
Job 13:26	For you write bitter things against me, and you want to consume me for the sins of my youth.
Job 13:27	You have put my feet on a tether, and you have observed all my paths, and you have considered the steps of my feet.
Job 13:28	I will be left to decay like something rotten and like a garment that is being eaten by moths.
Job 14:1	Man, born of woman, living for a short time, is filled with many miseries.
Job 14:2	He comes forth like a flower, and is crushed, and he flees, as if a shadow, and never remains in the same state.
Job 14:3	And do you consider it fitting to look down with your eyes on someone in this way and to lead him into judgment with you?
Job 14:4	Who can make him clean who is conceived of unclean seed? Are you not the only one who can?
Job 14:5	The days of man are short, and the number of his months is with you; you have determined his limits, which cannot be surpassed.
Job 14:6	Withdraw a little from him, so that he may rest, until his awaited day arrives, like that of the hired hand.
Job 14:7	A tree has hope: if it has been cut, it turns green again, and its branches spring forth.
Job 14:8	If its roots grow old in the earth, and its trunk passes into dust,
Job 14:9	at the scent of water, it will sprout and bring forth leaves, as when it had first been planted.
Job 14:10	Truly, when a man dies, and has been left unprotected, and has decayed, I ask you where is he?
Job 14:11	It is as if the waters had receded from the sea and an emptied river had dried up;
Job 14:12	just so, when a man is fallen asleep, he will not rise again, until the heavens are worn away; he will not awaken, nor rise from his sleep.
Job 14:13	Who will grant this to me, that you will protect me in the underworld, and hide me until your fury passes by, and establish a time for me, in which you will remember me?
Job 14:14	Do you suppose that a dead man will live again? On each of the days in which I now battle, I wait until my transformation occurs.
Job 14:15	You will call me and I will answer you; to the work of your hands, you will extend your right hand.
Job 14:16	Indeed, you have numbered my steps, but you have been lenient with my sins.
Job 14:17	You have sealed up my offenses, as if in a purse, but you have cured my iniquity.
Job 14:18	A falling mountain flows away, and a stone is transferred from its place.
Job 14:19	Waters wear away stones, and with a flood the land is reduced little by little; and similarly, you will destroy man.
Job 14:20	You have strengthened him for a little while, so that he may cross over into eternity. You will change his face and send him forth.
Job 14:21	Whether his sons have been noble or ignoble, he will not understand.
Job 14:22	And in this way his body, while he yet lives, will have grief, and his soul will mourn over himself.
Job 15:1	But Eliphaz the Themanite, answering, said:
Job 15:2	Will a wise man answer as if he were speaking wind, and will he fill his stomach with fire?
Job 15:3	You rebuke with words he who is not equal to you, and you speak what is not expedient for you,
Job 15:4	to such an extent that, within yourself, you have expelled reverence and have taken away prayers from the presence of God.
Job 15:5	For your iniquity has mislead your mouth, and you imitate the tongue of blasphemers.
Job 15:6	Your own mouth will condemn you, not I; and your own lips will answer you.
Job 15:7	Are you the first man who was born, or were you formed before the hills?
Job 15:8	Have you heard the intentions of God, and will his wisdom be inferior to you?
Job 15:9	What do you know, about which we are ignorant? What do you understand that we do not know?
Job 15:10	There are with us both aged and ancient men, even more senior than your fathers.
Job 15:11	Is it so important that God should console you? But your own depraved words prevent this.
Job 15:12	Why does your heart exalt you, and why do you gaze with your eyes, as if thinking great things?
Job 15:13	Why does your spirit stir against God, so as to utter such speeches from your mouth?
Job 15:14	What is man that he should be immaculate, and that he should appear just, having been born of woman?
Job 15:15	Behold, among his holy ones not one is immutable, and even the heavens are not pure in his sight.
Job 15:16	How much more abominable and useless is the man who drinks as if from the water of iniquity?
Job 15:17	I will reveal to you, so listen to me; and I will explain to you what I have seen.
Job 15:18	The wise acknowledge, and they do not leave behind, their fathers,
Job 15:19	to whom alone the earth has been given, and no stranger passed among them.
Job 15:20	The impious is arrogant for all his days, and the number of the years of his tyranny is uncertain.
Job 15:21	The sound of terror is always in his ears; and when there is peace, he always suspects treason.
Job 15:22	He does not believe that it is possible for him to be turned from darkness into the light, for he sees around him the sword on every side.
Job 15:23	When he moves himself to seek bread, he knows that the day of darkness has been prepared for his hand.
Job 15:24	Tribulation will terrify him, and anguish will prevail over him, like a king who is being prepared to go to battle.
Job 15:25	For he has extended his hand against God, and he has strengthened himself against the Almighty.
Job 15:26	He has rushed against him with his throat exposed, and he has been armed with a fat neck.
Job 15:27	Thickness has covered his face, and lard hangs down from his sides.
Job 15:28	He has lived in desolate cities and deserted houses, which have been turned into tombs.
Job 15:29	He will not be enriched, nor will his basic necessities endure, nor will he establish his root in the earth.
Job 15:30	He will not withdraw from the darkness; the flame will burn up his branches, and he will be defeated by the breath of his own mouth.
Job 15:31	He will not believe, being vainly deceived by error, that he could be redeemed at any price.
Job 15:32	Before his time is completed, he will pass into ruin and his hands will wither away.
Job 15:33	He will be wounded like a grapevine, when its cluster is in first flower, and like an olive tree that casts off its flower.
Job 15:34	For the congregation of the hypocrites is fruitless, and fire will devour the tabernacles of those who love to accept money.
Job 15:35	He has conceived sorrow, and he has brought forth iniquity, and his womb prepares deceit.
Job 16:1	Then Job, answering, said:
Job 16:2	I have often heard such things; you are all aggravating comforters.
Job 16:3	Will there be no end to windy words? Or is it at all a burden to you, if you speak?
Job 16:4	I, too, can speak like you; and I also wish that your soul favored my soul. I would also comfort you with speeches and would wag my head over you.
Job 16:5	I would strengthen you with my mouth, and would move my lips, as if being lenient to you.
Job 16:6	But what can I do? When I am speaking, my grief will not be quiet; and if I am quiet, it will not withdraw from me.
Job 16:7	But now my grief has crushed me, and all my limbs have been reduced to nothing.
Job 16:8	My wrinkles bear witness against me, and a liar rises up against my face, contradicting me.
Job 16:9	He has gathered together his fury towards me, and, threatening me, he has roared against me with his teeth; my enemy has beheld me with terrible eyes.
Job 16:10	They have opened their mouths against me, and, reproaching me, they have struck me on the cheek; they are nourished by my sufferings.
Job 16:11	God has confined me with the immoral, and he has delivered me into the hands of the impious.
Job 16:12	I, who once was wealthy, am now crushed. He has grabbed me by my neck; he has broken me and has place me before him as a sign.
Job 16:13	He has surrounded me with his lances. He has severely wounded my lower back, he has not been lenient, and he has poured out my organs upon the earth.
Job 16:14	He has cut me with wound after wound. He has rushed upon me like a giant.
Job 16:15	I have sewn sackcloth over my skin, and I have covered my body with ashes.
Job 16:16	My face is swollen from weeping, and my eyelids have dimmed my vision.
Job 16:17	These things I have endured without iniquity in my hand, while I held pure prayers before God.
Job 16:18	O earth, do not conceal my blood, nor let my outcry find a hiding place in you.
Job 16:19	For behold, my witness is in heaven, and my confidante is on high.
Job 16:20	My friends are full of words; my eye rains tears upon God.
Job 16:21	And I wish that a man might be so judged before God, just as the son of man is judged with his assistant!
Job 16:22	For behold, a few years pass by, and I am walking a path by which I will not return.
Job 17:1	My spirit will be wasted, my days will be shortened, and only the grave will left for me.
Job 17:2	I have not sinned, yet my eye remains in bitterness.
Job 17:3	Free me, O Lord, and set me beside you, and let the hand of anyone you wish fight against me.
Job 17:4	You have set their heart far from discipline; therefore, they will not be praised.
Job 17:5	He promises prey to his companions, but the eyes of his sons will grow faint.
Job 17:6	He has posted me like a proverb to the people, and I am an example in their presence.
Job 17:7	My eyesight has been clouded by indignation, and my limbs have been reduced, as if to nothing.
Job 17:8	The just will be astounded over this, and the innocent will be stirred up against the hypocrite.
Job 17:9	And the just will cling to his way, and clean hands will increase strength.
Job 17:10	Therefore, be converted, all of you, and approach, for I do not find in you any wisdom.
Job 17:11	My days have passed away; my thoughts have been scattered, tormenting my heart.
Job 17:12	They have turned night into day, and I hope for light again after the darkness.
Job 17:13	If I should wait, the underworld is my house, and in darkness I have spread out my bed.
Job 17:14	I have said to decay and to worms: “You are my father, my mother, and my sister.”
Job 17:15	Therefore, where is my expectation now, and who is it that considers my patience?
Job 17:16	Everything of mine will descend into the deepest underworld; do you think that, in that place at least, there will be rest for me?
Job 18:1	But Baldad the Suhite responded by saying:
Job 18:2	How long will you throw around words? Understand first, and then let us speak.
Job 18:3	Why have we been treated like mules, as if we were unworthy before you?
Job 18:4	You, who ruins your own soul in your fury, will the earth be forsaken because of you, and will the cliffs be moved from their place?
Job 18:5	Will not the light of the impious be put out, and the flame of his fire refuse to shine?
Job 18:6	Light will become darkness in his tabernacle, and the lamp that is over him will be extinguished.
Job 18:7	His strong steps will be constrained, and his own counsel will cast him down uncontrollably.
Job 18:8	For he has caused his own feet to go into a net, and he has walked into its web.
Job 18:9	His heel will be held in a snare, and thirst will rage against him.
Job 18:10	A trap has been hidden for him in the earth, and a decoy, along his path.
Job 18:11	Horrifying things will terrify him everywhere and will entangle his feet.
Job 18:12	Let his strength be diminished by famine, and let starvation invade his ribs.
Job 18:13	Let it devour the beauty of his skin; let the ancient death consume his arms.
Job 18:14	Let his confidence be torn away from his tabernacle, and let ruin trample over him like a king.
Job 18:15	Let the companions of he who is not, dwell in his tabernacle; let brimstone rain down upon his tabernacle.
Job 18:16	Let his roots be dried up from beneath him, and his harvest be crushed from above.
Job 18:17	Let the memory of him perish from the earth, and let not his name be celebrated in the streets.
Job 18:18	He will expel him from light into darkness, and he will remove him from the world.
Job 18:19	Neither his offspring, nor his descendents, will exist among his people, nor will there be any remnants in his country.
Job 18:20	The last will be astonished at his day, and the first will be overcome with horror.
Job 18:21	And so, these are the tabernacles of the sinful, and this the place of he who does not know God.
Job 19:1	But Job answered by saying:
Job 19:2	How long will you afflict my soul and wear me down with words?
Job 19:3	So, ten times you confound me and are not ashamed to oppress me.
Job 19:4	Now, of course, if I have been ignorant, my ignorance will be with me.
Job 19:5	But you have risen up against me, and you accuse me to my disgrace.
Job 19:6	At least now you should understand that God has not afflicted me with a balanced judgment, though he has encompassed me with his scourges.
Job 19:7	Behold, I will cry out, enduring violence, and no one will hear. I will announce loudly, but there is no one who may judge.
Job 19:8	He has hemmed in my path, and I cannot pass; he has added darkness to my difficult path.
Job 19:9	He has plundered me of my glory, and he has stolen the crown from my head.
Job 19:10	He has destroyed me on every side, and I am lost, and, like an uprooted tree, he has taken away my hope.
Job 19:11	His fury has raged against me, and in this way he has treated me like his enemy.
Job 19:12	His troops have gathered together, and they have made their way to me, and they have besieged my tabernacle all around.
Job 19:13	He has put my brothers far from me, and my friends have withdrawn from me like strangers.
Job 19:14	My kinsmen have forsaken me, and those who knew me, have forgotten me.
Job 19:15	The inhabitants of my house and my maidservants treat me just as if I were a stranger, and I have been like an sojourner in their eyes.
Job 19:16	I called my servant, and he did not respond; I pleaded with him with my own mouth.
Job 19:17	My wife has shuddered at my breath, and I have begged the sons of my loins.
Job 19:18	Even the foolish have looked down on me, and, when I withdrew from them, they spoke ill of me.
Job 19:19	Those who were sometime my counselors, treat me like an abomination; and he whom I valued the most has turned against me.
Job 19:20	Since my flesh has been consumed, my bone adheres to my skin, and only my lips have been left around my teeth.
Job 19:21	Have mercy on me, have compassion on me, at least you my friends, because the hand of the Lord has touched me.
Job 19:22	Why do you pursue me just as God does, and satiate yourselves with my flesh?
Job 19:23	Who will grant to me that my words may be written down? Who will grant to me that they may be inscribed in a book,
Job 19:24	with an iron pen and a plate of lead, or else be carved in stone?
Job 19:25	For I know that my Redeemer lives, and on the last day I will rise out of the earth.
Job 19:26	And I will be enveloped again with my skin, and in my flesh I will see my God.
Job 19:27	It is he whom I myself will see, and he whom my eyes will behold, and no other. This, my hope, has taken rest in my bosom.
Job 19:28	Why then do you now say: “Let us pursue him, and let us find a basis to speak against him?”
Job 19:29	So then, flee from the face of the sword, for the sword is the avenger of iniquities; but know this: there is to be a judgment.
Job 20:1	Then Zophar the Naamathite answered by saying:
Job 20:2	In response, various thoughts succeed one another in me, and my mind moves quickly through different ideas.
Job 20:3	The teaching you use to admonish me, I will hear, and the spirit of my understanding will respond for me.
Job 20:4	This, I know, is from the beginning, from the time that man was set over the earth:
Job 20:5	that the praise of the impious shall be short, and the joy of the hypocrite lasts only a moment.
Job 20:6	If his pride ascends even towards the heavens, and his head touches the clouds,
Job 20:7	in the end, he will be destroyed like a trash heap, and those who had seen him will say: “Where is he?”
Job 20:8	Like a dream that flies away, he will not be found; he will pass away like a nightmare.
Job 20:9	The eyes that had seen him, will not see him; no longer will his own place admire him.
Job 20:10	His sons will be worn away by poverty, and his own hands will deliver his grief to him.
Job 20:11	His bones will be filled with the vices of his youth, and they will sleep with him in the dust.
Job 20:12	For, when evil will be sweet in his mouth, he will hide it under his tongue.
Job 20:13	He will permit it, and not abandon it, and he will conceal it in his throat.
Job 20:14	His bread in his belly will be turned into the venom of snakes within him.
Job 20:15	The riches that he devours, he will vomit up, and from his stomach God will draw them out.
Job 20:16	He will suck the head of snakes, and the tongue of the viper will kill him.
Job 20:17	(May he never see the streams of the river, the torrents of honey and butter.)
Job 20:18	He will be repaid for all he has done, yet he will not be consumed; according to the multitude of his schemes, so also will he suffer.
Job 20:19	For, having broken in, he stripped the poor. He has quickly stolen away a house he did not build.
Job 20:20	And yet his stomach will not be satisfied, and when he has the things he desires, he will not be able to possess them.
Job 20:21	Nothing remained of his portion, and, because of this, nothing will continue of his kind.
Job 20:22	When he will be satisfied, he will be constrained; he will seethe, and all anguish will fall upon him.
Job 20:23	May his stomach be filled, so that God may send forth the fury of his wrath to him and may rain down his battle upon him.
Job 20:24	He will flee from weapons of iron, and he will fall in an arc of brass,
Job 20:25	which had been drawn and had issued forth from its sheath, glittering in its bitterness: the horrible ones will go forth and approach over him.
Job 20:26	All darkness has been hidden in his secrecy. A fire that has not been set will devour him; he will be thrown down and forsaken in his tabernacle.
Job 20:27	The heavens will reveal his sinfulness, and the earth will rise up against him.
Job 20:28	The offspring of his house will be exposed; he will be pulled down in the day of God’s wrath.
Job 20:29	This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the inheritance of his words from the Lord.
Job 21:1	Then Job responded by saying:
Job 21:2	I beseech you to hear my words and to do penance.
Job 21:3	Permit me, and I will speak, and afterwards, if you see fit, you can laugh at my words.
Job 21:4	Is my dispute against man, so that I would have no reason to be discouraged?
Job 21:5	Listen to me and be astonished, and place a finger over your mouth.
Job 21:6	As for me, when I think it over, I am afraid, and trembling convulses my body.
Job 21:7	Why then do the impious live, having been lifted up and strengthened with riches?
Job 21:8	They see their offspring continue before them: a commotion of close relatives and of children’s children in their sight.
Job 21:9	Their houses have been secure and peaceable, and there is no staff of God over them.
Job 21:10	Their cattle have conceived and have not miscarried; their cow has given birth and is not deprived of her newborn.
Job 21:11	Their little ones go out like a flock, and their children jump around playfully.
Job 21:12	They take up the timbrel and the lyre, and they rejoice at the sound of the organ.
Job 21:13	Their days are prolonged in wealth, yet, in an instant, they descend into hell.
Job 21:14	Who has said to God, “Depart from us, for we do not want the knowledge of your ways.
Job 21:15	Who is the Almighty that we should serve him? And how is it helpful to us if we pray to him?”
Job 21:16	It is true that their good things are not in their power. May the counsel of the impious be far from me!
Job 21:17	How often will the lamp of the wicked be extinguished, and a deluge overtake them, and how often will he distribute the afflictions of his wrath?
Job 21:18	They will be like chaff before the face of the wind, and like ashes that the whirlwind scatters.
Job 21:19	God will preserve the grief of the father for his sons, and, when he repays, then he will understand.
Job 21:20	His eyes will see his own destruction, and he will drink from the wrath of the Almighty.
Job 21:21	For what does he care what happens to his house after him, or if the number of its months are reduced by half?
Job 21:22	Can anyone teach holy knowledge to God, who judges the exalted?
Job 21:23	This one dies strong and healthy, rich and happy.
Job 21:24	His gut is full of fat and his bones are moistened with marrow.
Job 21:25	In truth, another dies in bitterness of soul, without any resources.
Job 21:26	And yet they will sleep together in the dust, and worms will cover them.
Job 21:27	Surely, I know your thoughts and your sinful judgments against me.
Job 21:28	For you say, “Where is the house of the ruler, and where are the tabernacles of the impious?”
Job 21:29	Ask any passerby whom you wish, and you will realize that he understands these same things:
Job 21:30	that the evil-doer is reserved for the day of destruction, and he will be led to the day of wrath.
Job 21:31	Who will reprove his way to his face, and who will repay him for what he has done?
Job 21:32	He will be led to the tomb, and he will remain awake in the chaos of the dead.
Job 21:33	He has been found acceptable to the banks of the River of Lamentation, and he will draw any man towards him, and there are countless before him.
Job 21:34	Therefore, how long will you console me in vain, when your answer is shown to be repugnant to truth?
Job 22:1	Then Eliphaz the Themanite responded by saying:
Job 22:2	Can man be compared with God, even if he were perfect in knowledge?
Job 22:3	What advantage is it to God, if you were just? Or what do you provide for him, if your way should be immaculate?
Job 22:4	Will he reprove you and take you to judgment for being afraid,
Job 22:5	and not because of your many evil deeds and your infinite unfairness?
Job 22:6	For you have taken away the collateral of your brothers without cause, and stripped them naked of their clothing.
Job 22:7	You have not given water to the weary; you have taken bread away from the hungry.
Job 22:8	By the strength of your arm, you took possession of the land, and you retain it by being the strongest.
Job 22:9	You have sent widows away empty, and you have crushed the shoulders of orphans.
Job 22:10	Because of this, you are surrounded by traps, and unexpected fears will disturb you.
Job 22:11	And did you think that you would not see darkness and that you were not to be overwhelmed by the on-rush of overflowing waters?
Job 22:12	Have you not considered that God is higher than the heavens and is lifted above the height of the stars?
Job 22:13	And you say: “Well, what does God know?” and, “He judges, as if through a fog,”
Job 22:14	and, “The clouds are his hiding-place,” and, “He does not examine us closely,” and, “He makes his rounds at the limits of the heavens.”
Job 22:15	Do you not want to tend the path of the ages, which wicked men have spurned?
Job 22:16	These were taken away before their time, and a flood overthrew their foundation.
Job 22:17	They said to God, “Withdraw from us,” and they treated the Almighty as if he could do nothing,
Job 22:18	though he had filled their houses with good things. May their way of thinking be far from me.
Job 22:19	The just will see and will rejoice, and the innocent will mock them.
Job 22:20	Has not their haughtiness been cut down, and has not fire devoured the remnants of them?
Job 22:21	So, repose yourself with him and be at peace, and, in this way, you will have the best fruits.
Job 22:22	Accept the law from his mouth, and place his words in your heart.
Job 22:23	If you will return to the Almighty, you will be rebuilt, and you will put sinfulness far from your tabernacle.
Job 22:24	He will give you stone in place of dirt, and torrents of gold in place of stone.
Job 22:25	And the Almighty will be against your enemies, and silver will be gathered together for you.
Job 22:26	Then will you flock together in delight over the Almighty, and you will lift up your face to God.
Job 22:27	You will plead with him, and he will listen to you, and you will pay your vows.
Job 22:28	You will decide on something, and it will come to you, and the light will shine in your ways.
Job 22:29	For he who had been humbled, will be in glory; and he who will lower his eyes, will be the one saved.
Job 22:30	The innocent will be saved, and he will be saved with purity in his hands.
Job 23:1	Then Job answered by saying:
Job 23:2	Now again my conversation is in bitterness, and the force of my scourging weighs more heavily on me because of my mourning.
Job 23:3	Who will grant me that I might know and find him, and that I may approach even to his throne?
Job 23:4	I would place judgment before his eye, and my mouth would fill with criticism,
Job 23:5	so that I may know the words that he will answer me and understand what he will say to me.
Job 23:6	I do not want him to contend with me with much strength, nor to overwhelm me with the bulk of his greatness.
Job 23:7	Let him show fairness in response to me, and let my judgment reach to victory.
Job 23:8	If I go to the east, he does not appear; if I go to the west, I will not understand him.
Job 23:9	If I turn to the left, what can I do? I will not take hold of him. If I turn myself to the right, I will not see him.
Job 23:10	Truly, he knows my way and has tested me like gold that passes through fire.
Job 23:11	My feet have been following his footsteps; I have kept to his way and have not strayed from it.
Job 23:12	I have not withdrawn from the commands of his lips, and the words of his mouth I have hidden in my sinews.
Job 23:13	For he is alone, and no one is able to disturb his intention; and whatever his spirit wills, that he accomplishes.
Job 23:14	And when he fulfills his will in me, many other similar ones will also be present with him.
Job 23:15	And, for this reason, I have been troubled at his presence, and, when I consider him, I am approached by fear.
Job 23:16	God has weakened my heart, and the Almighty has confused me.
Job 23:17	Yet I have not perished because of the threatening darkness, nor has gloom covered my face.
Job 24:1	The times are not hidden from the Almighty; even those who know him, do not know his days.
Job 24:2	Some have crossed the boundaries, plundered the flocks, and given them pasture.
Job 24:3	They have driven away the donkey of orphans, and have taken the cow from the widow as collateral.
Job 24:4	They have undermined the way of the poor, and have pressed together the meek of the earth.
Job 24:5	Others, like wild asses in the desert, go forth to their work; by watching for prey, they obtain bread for their children.
Job 24:6	They reap a field that is not their own, and they harvest a vineyard that they have taken by force.
Job 24:7	They send men away naked, having taken the clothing of those who have no covering in the cold;
Job 24:8	these are wet with the mountain rain, and, having no covering, they embrace the rocks.
Job 24:9	They have used violence to deprive orphans, and they have robbed the poor common people.
Job 24:10	From the naked and those who do not have enough clothing, and from the hungry, they have taken away sheaves of grain.
Job 24:11	They take their midday rest among the stockpiles of those who, though they have trodden the winepresses, suffer thirst.
Job 24:12	In the cities, they caused the men to groan and the spirit of the wounded to cry out, and so God does not allow this to go unpunished.
Job 24:13	They have been rebellious against the light; they have not known his ways, nor have they returned by his paths.
Job 24:14	The killer of men rises at first light; he executes the destitute and the poor, but, in truth, he is like a thief in the night.
Job 24:15	The eye of the adulterer waits for darkness, saying, “No eye will see me,” and he covers his face.
Job 24:16	He passes through houses in the nighttime, just as they had agreed among themselves in the daytime; and they are ignorant of the light.
Job 24:17	If sunrise should suddenly appear, it is treated by them like the shadow of death; and they walk in darkness, as if in light.
Job 24:18	He is nimble on the surface of water. His place on land is to be accursed. May he not walk by way of the vineyards.
Job 24:19	May he cross from the snowy waters to excessive heat, and his sin, all the way to hell.
Job 24:20	Let mercy forget him. His charm is worms. Let him not be remembered, but instead be broken like an unfruitful tree.
Job 24:21	For he has fed on the barren, who does not bear fruit, and he has not done good to the widow.
Job 24:22	He has pulled down the strong by his strength, and, when he stands up, he will not have trust in his life.
Job 24:23	God has given him a place for repentance, and he abuses it with arrogance, but his eyes are upon his ways.
Job 24:24	They are lifted up for a little while, but they will not continue, and they will be brought low, just like all things, and they will be taken away, and, like the tops of the ears of grain, they will be crushed.
Job 24:25	But, if this is not so, who is able to prove to me that I have lied and to place my words before God?
Job 25:1	Then Baldad the Suhite answered by saying:
Job 25:2	Power and terror are with him that makes a pact with those in high places.
Job 25:3	Is there any limit to the number of his soldiers or to the number of those over whom his light rises?
Job 25:4	Is it right for man to compare himself to God, or to appear pure though he is born of woman?
Job 25:5	Behold, even the moon is not radiant, and the stars are not pure, in his sight.
Job 25:6	Is man much more than rottenness and the son of man much more than worms?
Job 26:1	Then Job responded by saying:
Job 26:2	Whose assistant are you? Is he weak-minded? And do you sustain the arm of him that is not strong?
Job 26:3	To whom have you given advice? Perhaps it is to him that has no wisdom or prudence that you have revealed your many ideas.
Job 26:4	Who is it that you wanted to teach? Was it not him that created the breath of life?
Job 26:5	Behold, giant things groan under the waters, and they dwell with them.
Job 26:6	The underworld is naked before him, and there is no covering for perdition.
Job 26:7	He stretched out the North over emptiness, and he suspended the land over nothing.
Job 26:8	He secures the waters in his clouds, so that they do not burst forth downward all at once.
Job 26:9	He holds back the face of his throne, and he stretches his cloud over it.
Job 26:10	He has set limits around the waters, until light and darkness shall reach their limit.
Job 26:11	The pillars of heaven tremble and are frightened at his nod.
Job 26:12	By his strength, the seas suddenly gather together, and his foresight has struck the arrogant.
Job 26:13	His spirit has adorned the heavens, and his birthing hand has brought forth the winding serpent.
Job 26:14	Behold, these things have been said about his ways in part, and, since we barely have heard a small drop of his word, who will be able to gaze upon the thunder of his greatness?
Job 27:1	Job also added to this, using figures of speech, and he said:
Job 27:2	As God lives, who has taken away my judgment, and the Almighty, who has led my soul to bitterness,
Job 27:3	as long as my breath remains in me and the breath of God remains in my nostrils,
Job 27:4	my lips will not speak iniquity, nor will my tongue devise lies.
Job 27:5	Far be it from me that I should judge you to be right, for, until I expire, I will not withdraw from my innocence.
Job 27:6	I will not forsake my justification, which I have just begun to grasp, for my heart does not find blame for me in my whole life.
Job 27:7	Let the impious be as my enemy, and the sinful, as my adversary.
Job 27:8	For what hope is there for the hypocrite, if he greedily plunders and God does not free his soul?
Job 27:9	Will God pay attention to his cry, when anguish overcomes him?
Job 27:10	Or will he take delight in the Almighty and call upon God at all times?
Job 27:11	I will teach you through the hand of God, what the Almighty holds, and I will not conceal it.
Job 27:12	Behold, you know all this, and so why do you speak vain things without a reason?
Job 27:13	This is the portion of the impious man with God, and the inheritance of the violent, which they will receive from the Almighty.
Job 27:14	If his sons should happen to increase, they will be for the sword, and his grandsons will not be satisfied with bread.
Job 27:15	Whatever will remain of him will be buried in the ruins, and his widows will not weep.
Job 27:16	If he will amass silver as if it were dirt and fabricate garments as if they were clay,
Job 27:17	then yes, he will gather, but the just will be clothed with it and the innocent will divide the silver.
Job 27:18	He has built his house like a moth, and he has made a makeshift shelter like a sentry.
Job 27:19	When he falls asleep, the rich man will leave him with nothing; he will open his eyes and find nothing.
Job 27:20	Destitution will surround him like water; a storm will overwhelm him in the night.
Job 27:21	A burning wind will pick him up and carry him away, and, like a whirlwind, it will rush him from his place.
Job 27:22	And it will hurl over him and will not spare him; fleeing from its power, he will go into exile.
Job 27:23	He will clasp his hands over himself, and he will hiss at himself, while considering his situation.
Job 28:1	Silver has its fissures where it is first found, and gold has a place where it is melted.
Job 28:2	Iron is taken from the earth, and ore, unbound by heat, is turned into brass.
Job 28:3	He has established a time for darkness, and he has settled on an end for all things, as well as for the stone that is in the gloom and shadow of death.
Job 28:4	The burning separates a pilgrim people from those who have been forgotten by the feet of the destitute man and from the unapproachable.
Job 28:5	The land, where bread appeared in its place, has been destroyed by fire.
Job 28:6	Its stones are embedded with sapphires, and its soil, with gold.
Job 28:7	The bird does not know its path, nor has the eye of the vulture beheld it.
Job 28:8	The sons of merchants have not walked there, nor has the lioness traveled through it.
Job 28:9	He has stretched out his hand to the rocks; he has overturned the foundations of the mountains.
Job 28:10	He has cut rivers through the rocks, and his eye has seen all precious things.
Job 28:11	The depths of rivers he has also examined, and he has brought hidden things into the light.
Job 28:12	But, in truth, where is wisdom to be found, and where is the place of understanding?
Job 28:13	Man does not know its price, nor is it found in the land of those who live in sweetness.
Job 28:14	The abyss declares, “It is not in me.” And the sea says, “It is not with me.”
Job 28:15	The finest gold will not be paid for it, nor will silver be weighed in exchange for it.
Job 28:16	It will not be compared with the dyed colors of India, nor with the very costly stone sardonyx, nor with the sapphire.
Job 28:17	Neither gold nor crystal will be its equal; neither will vessels of gold be fitted for it.
Job 28:18	The exalted and the eminent will not be remembered in comparison with it. Yet wisdom is drawn out of concealment.
Job 28:19	The topaz of Ethiopia will not be equal to it, nor will it be compared to the purest dyes.
Job 28:20	So then, where does wisdom begin, and where is the place of understanding?
Job 28:21	It has been hidden from the eyes of all living things, just as the birds of the heavens escape notice.
Job 28:22	Perdition and death have said, “With our ears, we have heard its fame.”
Job 28:23	God understands its way, and he knows its location.
Job 28:24	For he beholds the limits of the world, and he looks upon all things that are under heaven.
Job 28:25	He created a counterweight for the winds, and he suspended the waters to measure them.
Job 28:26	At that time, he gave a law to the rain and a path to the resounding storms.
Job 28:27	Then he saw and explained it, and he made ready and examined it.
Job 28:28	And he said to man, “Behold the fear of the Lord. Such is wisdom. And to withdraw from evil, this is understanding.”
Job 29:1	Job also added to this, using figures of speech, and he said:
Job 29:2	Who will grant to me that I might be as I was in former months, according to the days when God kept watch over me?
Job 29:3	At that time, his lamp shined over my head, and by his light, I walked through the darkness.
Job 29:4	I was then just as in the days of my youth, when God was privately in my tabernacle.
Job 29:5	At that time, the Almighty was with me and my children surrounded me.
Job 29:6	Then, I washed my feet with butter, and a boulder poured out rivers of oil for me.
Job 29:7	When I went to the gate of the city, or to the main street, they prepared a chair for me.
Job 29:8	The youths saw me and hid themselves, and the elders, rising up, remained standing.
Job 29:9	The leaders stopped talking, and they placed a finder over their mouth.
Job 29:10	The commanders subdued their voice, and their tongue adhered to their throat.
Job 29:11	The ear that heard me, blessed me, and the eye that saw me, gave testimony for me.
Job 29:12	This was because I had freed the poor, who cried out, and the orphan, who had no helper.
Job 29:13	The blessing of him who would have been destroyed came upon me, and I consoled the heart of the widow.
Job 29:14	I put on justice, and I clothed myself with my judgment, like a robe and a diadem.
Job 29:15	I was an eye for the blind and a foot for the lame.
Job 29:16	I was the father of the poor; and if I lacked knowledge about any case, I investigated very diligently.
Job 29:17	I crushed the jaws of the impious, and I took away prey from his teeth.
Job 29:18	And I said, “I will die in my little nest, and like a palm tree, I will multiply my days.
Job 29:19	My root has been spread beside the waters, and the dew will remain with my harvest.
Job 29:20	My glory will always be restored, and my bow will be restored to my hand.”
Job 29:21	Those who heard me, expected vindication, and they listened closely in silence to my counsel.
Job 29:22	To my words, they dared to add nothing, and my eloquence poured over them.
Job 29:23	They waited for me as for rain, and they opened their mouth as for belated rains.
Job 29:24	If I had ever laughed at them, they would not have believed it, and the light of my face was not cast down towards the ground.
Job 29:25	If I wished to go to them, I sat down first, and, though I sat like a king surrounded by an army, yet I was a comforter to whose who mourned.
Job 30:1	But now, those younger in years scorn me, whose fathers I would not have seen fit to place with the dogs of my flock,
Job 30:2	the strength of whose hands was nothing to me, and they were considered unworthy of life itself.
Job 30:3	They were barren from poverty and hunger; they gnawed in solitude, layered with misfortune and misery.
Job 30:4	And they chewed grass and the bark from trees, and the root of junipers was their food.
Job 30:5	They took these things from the steep valleys, and when they discovered one of these things, they rushed to the others with a cry.
Job 30:6	They lived in the parched desert and in caves underground or above the rocks.
Job 30:7	They rejoiced among these kinds of things, and they considered it delightful to be under thorns.
Job 30:8	These are the sons of foolish and base men, not even paying any attention to the land.
Job 30:9	Now I become their song, and I have been made into their proverb.
Job 30:10	They loathe me, and so they flee far from me, and they are not reluctant to spit in my face.
Job 30:11	For he has opened his quiver and has afflicted me, and he has placed a bridle in my mouth.
Job 30:12	Immediately, upon rising, my calamities rise up to the right. They have overturned my feet and have pressed me down along their way like waves.
Job 30:13	They have diverted my journeys; they have waited to ambush me, and they have prevailed, and there was no one who might bring help.
Job 30:14	They have rushed upon me, as when a wall is broken or a gate opened, and they have been pulled down into my miseries.
Job 30:15	I have been reduced to nothing. You have taken away my desire like a wind, and my health has passed by like a cloud.
Job 30:16	But now my soul withers within myself, and the days of affliction take hold of me.
Job 30:17	At night, my bone is pierced with sorrows, and those who feed on me, do not sleep.
Job 30:18	By the sheer number of them my clothing is worn away, and they have closed in on me like the collar of my coat.
Job 30:19	I have been treated like dirt, and I have been turned into embers and ashes.
Job 30:20	I cry to you, and you do not heed me. I stand up, and you do not look back at me.
Job 30:21	You have changed me into hardness, and, with the hardness of your hand, you oppose me.
Job 30:22	You have lifted me up, and, placing me as if on the wind, you have thrown me down powerfully.
Job 30:23	I know that you will hand me over to death, where a home has been established for all the living.
Job 30:24	Truly, then, you do not extend your hand in order to consume them, and if they fall down, you will save them.
Job 30:25	Once, I wept over him who was afflicted, and my soul had compassion on the poor.
Job 30:26	I expected good things, but evil things have come to me. I stood ready for light, yet darkness burst forth.
Job 30:27	My insides have seethed, without any rest, for the days of affliction have prevented it.
Job 30:28	I went forth mourning, without anger, and rising up, I cried out in confusion.
Job 30:29	I was the brother of snakes, and the companion of ostriches.
Job 30:30	My skin has become blackened over me, and my bones have dried up because of the heat.
Job 30:31	My harp has been turned into mourning, and my pipes have been turned into a voice of weeping.
Job 31:1	I reached an agreement with my eyes, that I would not so much as think about a virgin.
Job 31:2	For what portion should God from above hold for me, and what inheritance should the Almighty from on high keep?
Job 31:3	Is not destruction held for the wicked and repudiation kept for those who work injustice?
Job 31:4	Does he not examine my ways and number all my steps?
Job 31:5	If I have walked in vanity, or if my foot has hurried towards deceitfulness,
Job 31:6	let him weigh me in a just balance, and let God know my simplicity.
Job 31:7	If my steps have turned aside from the way, or if my heart has followed my eyes, or if a blemish has clung to my hands,
Job 31:8	then may I sow, and let another consume, and let my offspring be eradicated.
Job 31:9	If my heart has been deceived over a woman, or if I have waited in ambush at my friend’s door,
Job 31:10	then let my wife be the harlot of another, and let other men lean over her.
Job 31:11	For this is a crime and a very great injustice.
Job 31:12	It is a fire devouring all the way to perdition, and it roots out all that springs forth.
Job 31:13	If I have despised being subject to judgment with my servant or my maid, when they had any complaint against me,
Job 31:14	then what will I do when God rises to judge, and, when he inquires, how will I respond to him?
Job 31:15	Is not he who created me in the womb, also he who labored to make him? And did not one and the same form me in the womb?
Job 31:16	If I have denied the poor what they wanted and have made the eyes of the widow wait;
Job 31:17	if I have eaten my morsel of food alone, while orphans have not eaten from it;
Job 31:18	(for from my infancy mercy grew with me, and it came out with me from my mother’s womb;)
Job 31:19	if I have looked down on him who was perishing because he had no clothing and the poor without any covering,
Job 31:20	if his sides have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
Job 31:21	if I have lifted up my hand over an orphan, even when it might seem to me that I the advantage over him at the gate;
Job 31:22	then may my shoulder fall from its joint, and may my arm, with all its bones, be broken.
Job 31:23	For I have always feared God, like waves flowing over me, whose weight I was unable to bear.
Job 31:24	If I have considered gold to be my strength, or if I have called purified gold ‘my Trust;’
Job 31:25	if I have rejoiced over my great success, and over the many things my hand has obtained;
Job 31:26	if I gazed upon the sun when it shined and the moon advancing brightly,
Job 31:27	so that my heart rejoiced in secret and I kissed my hand with my mouth,
Job 31:28	which is a very great iniquity and a denial against the most high God;
Job 31:29	if I have been glad at the ruin of him who hated me and have exulted that evil found him,
Job 31:30	for I have not been given my throat to sin by asking for a curse on his soul;
Job 31:31	if the men around my tabernacle have not said: “He might give us some of his food, so that we will be filled,”
Job 31:32	for the foreigner did not remain at the door, my door was open to the traveler;
Job 31:33	if, as man does, I have hidden my sin and have concealed my iniquity in my bosom;
Job 31:34	if I became frightened by an excessive crowd, and the disrespect of close relatives alarmed me, so that I would much rather have remained silent or have gone out the door;
Job 31:35	then, would he grant me a hearing, so that the Almighty would listen to my desire, and he who judges would himself write a book,
Job 31:36	which I would then carry on my shoulder and wrap around me like a crown?
Job 31:37	With each of my steps, I would pronounce and offer it, as if to a prince.
Job 31:38	So, if my land cries out against me, and if its furrows weep with it,
Job 31:39	if I have used its fruits for nothing but money and have afflicted the souls of its tillers,
Job 31:40	then, may thistles spring forth for me instead of grain, and thorns instead of barley. (This ended the words of Job.)
Job 32:1	But these three men ceased to answer Job, because he considered himself justified.
Job 32:2	And Eliu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram, was angry and indignant. But he was angry against Job because he described himself to be just in the presence of God.
Job 32:3	Moreover, he was indignant with his friends because they had not found a reasonable response, except in so far as they condemned Job.
Job 32:4	Therefore, Eliu waited while Job was talking, for these were his elders that were speaking.
Job 32:5	But when he saw that these three were not able to respond, he was extremely angry.
Job 32:6	And so Eliu the son of Barachel the Buzite responded by saying: I am younger in years, and you are more ancient; therefore, I kept my head low, for I was afraid to reveal to you my opinion.
Job 32:7	For I had hoped that greater age would speak, and that a multitude of years would teach wisdom.
Job 32:8	But I see now that there is only breath in men, and that it is the inspiration of the Almighty that gives understanding.
Job 32:9	The wise are not the aged, nor do the elders understand judgment.
Job 32:10	Therefore, I will speak. Listen to me, and so I will show you my wisdom.
Job 32:11	For I have endured your words; I have paid attention to your deliberations, while you were being argumentative with words.
Job 32:12	And as long as I supposed that you were saying something, I considered; but now I see that there is none of you that is able to argue with Job and to respond to his words.
Job 32:13	So that you will not say, “We have found wisdom,” God has thrown him down, not man.
Job 32:14	He has said nothing to me, and I will not respond to him according to your words.
Job 32:15	Then they were filled with dread, and so they no longer responded, and they withdrew from their speechmaking.
Job 32:16	Therefore, because I have waited and they have not been speaking, for they stood firm and did not respond at all,
Job 32:17	I also will answer in my turn, and I will reveal my knowledge.
Job 32:18	For I am full of words, and the feeling in my gut inspires me.
Job 32:19	Yes, my stomach is like fermenting wine without a vent, which bursts the new containers.
Job 32:20	I should speak, but I will also breathe a little; I will open my lips, and I will answer.
Job 32:21	I will not esteem the reputation of a man, and I will not equate God with man.
Job 32:22	For I do not know how long I will continue, and whether, after a while, my Maker might take me away.
Job 33:1	Therefore, hear my speeches, Job, and listen to all my words.
Job 33:2	Behold, I have opened my mouth; let my tongue speak along with my throat.
Job 33:3	My words are from my simple heart, and my lips will speak a pure judgment.
Job 33:4	The Spirit of God made me, and the breath of the Almighty gave me life.
Job 33:5	If you can, answer me, and oppose me to my face.
Job 33:6	Behold, God has made me, just as he also has made you, and I, likewise, have been formed of the same clay.
Job 33:7	So, truly, do not let my wonders terrify you, and do not let my eloquence be burdensome to you.
Job 33:8	For you have spoken in my hearing, and I have heard the voice of your words, saying:
Job 33:9	“I am clean and without sin; I am immaculate, and there is no iniquity in me.
Job 33:10	Yet he has discovered blame in me, and so he has treated me like his enemy.
Job 33:11	He has put my feet in fetters; he has kept watch over all my ways.”
Job 33:12	Therefore, it is for this reason that you have not been justified. For I tell you that God is greater than man.
Job 33:13	Do you contend against him because he has not responded to all of your words?
Job 33:14	God speaks once, and he does not repeat the same thing a second time.
Job 33:15	Through a dream in a vision of the night, when a deep sleep falls over men, and they are sleeping in their beds,
Job 33:16	then, he opens the ears of men, and, educating them, he teaches discipline,
Job 33:17	so that he may divert a man from the things that he is doing, and may free him from pride,
Job 33:18	rescuing his soul from corruption and his life from passing away by the sword.
Job 33:19	Likewise, he rebukes by sorrow in bed, and he causes all of his bones to become weak.
Job 33:20	Bread becomes abominable to him in his life, and, to his soul, the meat which before he desired.
Job 33:21	His body will waste away, and his bones, which had been covered, will be revealed.
Job 33:22	His soul has approached corruption, and his life has drawn near to what is deadly.
Job 33:23	If there were an angel speaking for him, one among thousands, to declare the fairness of the man,
Job 33:24	he will have mercy on him, and he will say, “Free him, so that he will not descend to destruction. I have found a reason to be favorable to him.
Job 33:25	His body is consumed by suffering. Let him return to the days of his youth.”
Job 33:26	He will beg pardon from God, and he will be soothing to him; and he will look upon his face in jubilation, and he will restore his justice to man.
Job 33:27	He will consider mankind, and he will say: “I have sinned and truly I have offended, yet I was not treated as I deserved.”
Job 33:28	He has freed his soul from continuing into destruction, so that, in living, it may see the light.
Job 33:29	Behold, all these things God works three times within each one,
Job 33:30	so that he may revive their souls from corruption and enlighten them with the light of life.
Job 33:31	Pay attention Job, and listen to me; and remain silent, while I speak.
Job 33:32	Yet, if you have anything to say, answer me and speak, for I want you to be treated justly.
Job 33:33	But if you do not have anything to say, then listen to me. Be quiet and I will teach you wisdom.
Job 34:1	After proclaiming these things, Eliu now had this to say:
Job 34:2	May the wise hear my words, and may the educated listen to me.
Job 34:3	For the ear examines words, and the mouth discerns foods by the taste.
Job 34:4	Let us choose judgment for ourselves, and let us consider among ourselves what is best.
Job 34:5	For Job has said: “I am just, yet God has subverted my judgment.
Job 34:6	For, within my judgment, there is a lie: my vehement barbs are without any sin.”
Job 34:7	What man is there that is like Job, who drinks up derision as if it were water,
Job 34:8	who accompanies those who work iniquity, and who walks with impious men?
Job 34:9	For he has said, “Man will not please God, even if he should travel with him.”
Job 34:10	Therefore, prudent men, hear me: impiety is far from God, and iniquity is far from the Almighty.
Job 34:11	For he will restore to man his works, and according to the ways of each, he will repay them.
Job 34:12	For truly, God will not condemn in vain, nor will the Almighty repudiate judgment.
Job 34:13	What other is established over the earth? Or whom has he placed over the world, which he made?
Job 34:14	But, if he directs his heart towards him, he will draw his spirit and breath to himself.
Job 34:15	All flesh will fail together, and man will return to ashes.
Job 34:16	Therefore, if you have understanding, hear what is said, and heed the sound of my eloquence.
Job 34:17	Is he that does not love judgment able to be corrected? And how can you so greatly condemn him who is just?
Job 34:18	He says to the king, “You are an apostate.” He calls commanders impious.
Job 34:19	He does not accept the reputation of leaders; nor does he recognize the tyrant as he contends against the poor. For all are the work of his hands.
Job 34:20	They will die suddenly, and the people will be troubled in the middle of the night, but they will pass through it, and the violent will be taken away without a hand.
