Job 34:21	For his eyes are upon the ways of men, and he examines all of their steps.
Job 34:22	There is no darkness and no shadow of death, where those who work iniquity may be hidden.
Job 34:23	For it is no longer within the power of man to enter into judgment with God.
Job 34:24	He will break into many innumerable pieces, and he will cause others to stand up in their place.
Job 34:25	For he knows their works, and, as a result, he will bring the night, and they will be crushed.
Job 34:26	Just as the impious do, he has struck them in a place where they can be seen.
Job 34:27	They, as if with great diligence, have withdrawn from him, and they refused to understand all his ways,
Job 34:28	so that they caused the outcry of the needy to reach him, and he heard the voice of the poor.
Job 34:29	For, when he grants peace, who is there that can condemn? When he hides his face, who is there that can contemplate him, either among the nations, or among all men?
Job 34:30	He causes a hypocritical man to reign because of the sins of the people.
Job 34:31	Therefore, since I have been speaking about God, I will not prevent you from doing the same.
Job 34:32	If I have erred, you may teach me; if I have spoken unfairly, I will add no more.
Job 34:33	Does God require this of you because it is displeasing to you? For you were the first to speak, and not I. But if you know something better, speak.
Job 34:34	Let men of understanding speak to me, and let a wise man listen to me.
Job 34:35	But Job has been speaking foolishly, and his words contain unsound teaching.
Job 34:36	My father, let Job be tested even to the end; may you not retreat from a man of iniquity.
Job 34:37	For he adds blasphemy on top of his sins; nevertheless, let him be constrained to be among us, and then let him provoke God to judgment with his speeches.
Job 35:1	After this, Eliu again spoke in this way:
Job 35:2	Does it seem right to you in your thoughts, that you should say, “I am more just than God?”
Job 35:3	For you said, “Having done what is right does not please you,” and, “How will it benefit you, if I sin?”
Job 35:4	And so, I will respond to your words, and to your friends who are with you.
Job 35:5	Look up towards heaven and consider; also, think about the sky, which is higher than you.
Job 35:6	If you sin, how will it hurt him? And if your iniquities are multiplied, what will you do against him?
Job 35:7	Furthermore, if you act justly, what will you give him, or what will he receive from your hand?
Job 35:8	Your impiety may hurt a man who is like you, though your justice may help the son of the man.
Job 35:9	Because of the multitude of false accusers, they will cry out; and they will lament because of the strong arm of the tyrants.
Job 35:10	Yet he has not said: “Where is God, who made me, who has given songs in the night,
Job 35:11	who teaches us in addition to the beasts of the earth, and who educates us along with the birds of the air?”
Job 35:12	There they will cry, and he will not heed them, because of the arrogance of the wicked.
Job 35:13	Therefore, God does not hear in vain, and the Almighty will look into each and every case.
Job 35:14	And so, when you say, “He does not examine,” be judged before him, but wait for him.
Job 35:15	For, at the present time, he does not bring forth his fury, nor does he punish sin exceedingly.
Job 35:16	Therefore, Job has opened his mouth in vain and has multiplied words without knowledge.
Job 36:1	Continuing in a similar manner, Eliu had this to say:
Job 36:2	Bear with me for a little while and I will show you; for I have still more to say in favor of God.
Job 36:3	I will review my knowledge from the beginning, and I will prove my Maker to be just.
Job 36:4	For truly my words are without any falsehood and perfect knowledge will be proven to you.
Job 36:5	God does not abandon the powerful, for he himself is also powerful.
Job 36:6	But he does not save the impious, though he grants judgment to the poor.
Job 36:7	He will not take his eyes away from the just, and he continually establishes kings on their throne, and they are exalted.
Job 36:8	And, if they are in captivity, or are bound with the chains of poverty,
Job 36:9	he will reveal to them their works, as well as their sinfulness, in that they were violent.
Job 36:10	Likewise, he will open their ears to his correction, and he will speak to them, so that they may return from iniquity.
Job 36:11	If they listen and obey, they will fill their days with goodness and complete their years in glory.
Job 36:12	But if they will not listen, they will pass away by the sword and will be consumed by foolishness.
Job 36:13	The false and the crafty provoke the wrath of God, yet they do not cry out to him when they are chained.
Job 36:14	Their soul will die in a storm, and their life, among the unmanly.
Job 36:15	He will rescue the poor from his anguish, and he will open his ear during tribulation.
Job 36:16	Therefore, he will save you from the narrow mouth very widely, even though it has no foundation under it. Moreover, your respite at table will be full of fatness.
Job 36:17	Your case has been judged like that of the impious; you will withdraw your plea and your judgment.
Job 36:18	Therefore, do not let anger overwhelm you so that you oppress another; neither should you allow a multitude of gifts to influence you.
Job 36:19	Lay down your greatness without distress, and put aside all of your power with courage.
Job 36:20	Do not prolong the night, even if people rise on their behalf.
Job 36:21	Be careful that you do not turn to iniquity; for, after your misery, you have begun to follow this.
Job 36:22	Behold, God is exalted in his strength, and there is no one like him among the law-givers.
Job 36:23	Who is able to investigate his ways? And who can say, “You have done iniquity,” to him?
Job 36:24	Remember that you are ignorant of his work, yet men have sung its praises.
Job 36:25	All men consider him; and each one ponders from a distance.
Job 36:26	Behold, God is great, defeating our knowledge; the number of his years is inestimable.
Job 36:27	He carries away the drops of rain, and he sends forth showers like a raging whirlpool;
Job 36:28	they flow from the clouds that are woven above everything.
Job 36:29	If he wills it, he extends the clouds as his tent
Job 36:30	and shines with his light from above; likewise, he covers the oceans within his tent.
Job 36:31	For he judges the people by these things, and he gives food to a multitude of mortals.
Job 36:32	Within his hands, he hides the light, and he commands it to come forth again.
Job 36:33	He announces it to his friend, for it is his possession and he is able to reach out to it.
Job 37:1	At this, my heart became frightened, and it has been moved from its place.
Job 37:2	Pay close attention to the alarm of his voice and to the sound that proceeds from his mouth.
Job 37:3	He beholds everything under the heavens, and his light reaches beyond the ends of the earth.
Job 37:4	After this, a noise will sound; he will thunder with the voice of his greatness, and it will not be tracked down, yet his voice will be obeyed.
Job 37:5	God will thunder with his voice miraculously, for he performs great and unsearchable things.
Job 37:6	He commands the snow to descend on earth, and the winter rains, and the shower of his strength.
Job 37:7	He signs the hand of all men, so that each one may know his works.
Job 37:8	The beast will enter his hiding-place, and he will remain in his cave.
Job 37:9	From the interior, a storm will come forth, and a cold winter from the north.
Job 37:10	As God breathes out, frost forms, and the waters are poured forth very widely again.
Job 37:11	Crops desire clouds, and the clouds scatter their light.
Job 37:12	It shines all around, wherever the will of him that governs them will lead, to anywhere he will command, over the whole face of the earth,
Job 37:13	whether in one tribe, or in his own region, or in whatever place of his mercy that he will order them to be found.
Job 37:14	Listen to these things, Job. Stand up and consider the wonders of God.
Job 37:15	Do you know when God ordered the rains, so as to show the light of his clouds?
Job 37:16	Do you know the great paths of the clouds, and the perfect sciences?
Job 37:17	Are not your garments hot, when the south wind blows across the land?
Job 37:18	Perhaps you have made the heavens with him, which are very solid, as if they had been cast from brass.
Job 37:19	Reveal to us what we should say to him, for, of course, we are wrapped in darkness.
Job 37:20	Who will explain to him the things that I am saying? Even while a man is still speaking, he will be devoured.
Job 37:21	Although they do not see the light, the air will be thickened suddenly into clouds, and the wind, passing by, will drive them away.
Job 37:22	Riches arrive from the north, and fearful praise reaches out to God.
Job 37:23	We are not worthy to be able to find him. Great in strength, great in judgment, great in justice: he is indescribable.
Job 37:24	Therefore, men will fear him, and all those who seem to themselves to be wise, will not dare to contemplate him.
Job 38:1	But the Lord, responding to Job from a whirlwind, said:
Job 38:2	Who is this that wraps sentences in unskilled words?
Job 38:3	Gird your waist like a man. I will question you, and you must answer me.
Job 38:4	Where were you, when I set the foundations of the earth? Tell me, if you have understanding.
Job 38:5	Who set its measurements, if you know, or who stretched a line over it?
Job 38:6	Upon what have its bases been grounded, and who set forth its cornerstone,
Job 38:7	when the morning stars praised me together, and all the sons of God made a joyful noise?
Job 38:8	Who enclosed the sea with doors, when it broke forth as if issuing from the womb,
Job 38:9	when I stationed a cloud as its garment and wrapped it in a mist as if swaddling an infant?
Job 38:10	I encircled it with my limits, and I positioned its bars and doors.
Job 38:11	And I said: “This far you will approach, and you will proceeded no further, and here you will break your swelling waves.”
Job 38:12	Did you, after your birth, command the birth of the sun and show the sunrise its place?
Job 38:13	And did you hold the extremities of the earth, shaking them, and have you shaken the impious out of it?
Job 38:14	The seal will be restored like clay, and it will remain in place like a garment.
Job 38:15	From the impious, the light will be taken away, and the exalted arm will be broken.
Job 38:16	Have you entered the depths of the sea, and have you taken a walk in the uttermost parts of the abyss?
Job 38:17	Have the gates of death been opened to you, and have you seen the doors of darkness?
Job 38:18	Have you considered the breadth of the earth? If you know all things, reveal them to me.
Job 38:19	Which is the way that holds the light, and which is the place of darkness?
Job 38:20	In this way, you might lead each thing to its final place, and understand the paths of its house.
Job 38:21	So then, did you know when you were to be born? And did you know the number of your days?
Job 38:22	Have you been admitted into the storehouses of the snows, and have you gazed upon the stockpile of the brimstone,
Job 38:23	which I have prepared for the time of the enemy, for the day of the battle and the war?
Job 38:24	In what way is the light scattered, and the heat distributed, over the earth?
Job 38:25	Who gave a course to the rainstorms, and a path to the resounding thunder,
Job 38:26	so that it would rain on the earth far from man, in the wilderness where no mortal lingers,
Job 38:27	so that it would fill impassable and desolate places, and would bring forth green plants?
Job 38:28	Who is the father of rain, or who conceived the drops of dew?
Job 38:29	From whose womb did the ice proceed, and who created the frost from the air?
Job 38:30	The waters are hardened to become like stone, and the surface of the abyss freezes over.
Job 38:31	Will you have the strength to join together the sparkling stars of the Pleiades, or are you able to disperse the circling of Arcturus?
Job 38:32	Can you bring forth the morning star, in its time, and make the evening star rise over the sons of the earth?
Job 38:33	Do you know the order of heaven, and can you explain its rules here on the earth?
Job 38:34	Can you lift up your voice to the clouds, so that an onslaught of waters will cover you?
Job 38:35	Can you send forth lightning bolts, and will they go, and on returning, say to you: “Here we are?”
Job 38:36	Who placed discernment in the guts of man, or who gave the rooster intelligence?
Job 38:37	Who can describe the rules of the heavens, or who can put to rest the harmony of heaven?
Job 38:38	When was the dust cast to become the earth, and when were its clods fastened together?
Job 38:39	Will you seize prey for the lioness, and will you sustain the lives of her young,
Job 38:40	as they rest in their dens or lie in wait in pits?
Job 38:41	Who provides the raven with its meal, when her chicks cry out to God, as they wander around because they have no food?
Job 39:1	Do you know at what time the wild goats have given birth among the rocks, or do you observe the deer when they go into labor?
Job 39:2	Have you numbered the months since their conception, and do you know at what time they gave birth?
Job 39:3	They bend themselves for their offspring, and they give birth, and they emit roars.
Job 39:4	Their young are weaned and go out to feed; they depart and do not return to them.
Job 39:5	Who has set the wild ass free, and who has released his bonds?
Job 39:6	I have given a house in solitude to him, and his tabernacle is in the salted land.
Job 39:7	He despises the crowded city; he does not pay attention to the bellow of the tax collector.
Job 39:8	He looks around the mountains of his pasture, and he searches everywhere for green plants.
Job 39:9	Will the rhinoceros be willing to serve you, and will he remain in your stall?
Job 39:10	Can you detain the rhinoceros with your harness to plough for you, and will he loosen the soil of the furrows behind you?
Job 39:11	Will you put your faith in his great strength, and delegate your labors to him?
Job 39:12	Will you trust him to return to you the seed, and to gather it on your drying floor?
Job 39:13	The wing of the ostrich is like the wings of the heron, and of the hawk.
Job 39:14	When she leaves eggs behind in the earth, will you perhaps warm them in the dust?
Job 39:15	She forgets that feet may trample them, or that the beasts of the field may shatter them.
Job 39:16	She is hardened against her young, as if they were not hers; she has labored in vain, with no fear compelling her.
Job 39:17	For God has deprived her of wisdom; neither has he given her understanding.
Job 39:18	Yet, when the time is right, she raises her wings on high; she ridicules the horse and his rider.
Job 39:19	Will you supply strength to the horse, or envelope his throat with neighing?
Job 39:20	Will you alarm him as the locusts do? His panic is revealed by the display of his nostrils.
Job 39:21	He digs at the earth with his hoof; he jumps around boldly; he advances to meet armed men.
Job 39:22	He despises fear; he does not turn away from the sword.
Job 39:23	Above him, the quiver rattles, the spear and the shield shake.
Job 39:24	Seething and raging, he drinks up the earth; neither does he pause when the blast of the trumpet sounds.
Job 39:25	When he hears the bugle, he says, “Ha!” He smells the battle from a distance, the exhortation of the officers, and the battle cry of the soldiers.
Job 39:26	Does the hawk grow feathers by means of your wisdom, spreading her wings towards the south?
Job 39:27	Will the eagle lift herself up at your command and make her nest in steep places?
Job 39:28	She dwells among the rocks, and she lingers among broken boulders and inaccessible cliffs.
Job 39:29	From there, she looks for food, and her eyes catch sight of it from far away.
Job 39:30	Her young will drink blood, and wherever the carcass will be, she is there immediately.
Job 40:1	And the Lord continued, and he said to Job:
Job 40:2	Will he who contends with God be so easily silenced? Certainly, he who argues with God must also respond to him.
Job 40:3	Then Job answered the Lord, saying:
Job 40:4	What could I possibly answer, since I have been speaking thoughtlessly? I will place my hand over my mouth.
Job 40:5	One thing I have spoken, which I wish I had not said; and another, to which I will add no more.
Job 40:6	But the Lord, answering Job out of the whirlwind, said:
Job 40:7	Gird your waist like a man. I will question you, and you must answer me.
Job 40:8	Will you make my judgment null and void; and will you condemn me so that you may be justified?
Job 40:9	And do you have an arm like God, or a voice like thunder?
Job 40:10	Envelop yourself with splendor, and raise yourself up on high, and be glorious, and put on splendid garments.
Job 40:11	Scatter the arrogant with your wrath, and, when you see all the arrogant, humble them.
Job 40:12	Look down upon each of the arrogant and confound them, and crush the impious in their place.
Job 40:13	Hide them in the dust together and plunge their faces into the pit.
Job 40:14	Then I will confess that your right hand is able to save you.
Job 40:15	Behold, the behemoth, whom I created along with you, eats hay like an ox.
Job 40:16	His strength is in his lower back, and his power is in the center of his abdomen.
Job 40:17	He draws up his tail like a cedar; the sinews of his thighs have been drawn together.
Job 40:18	His bones are like pipes of brass; his cartilage is like plates of iron.
Job 40:19	He is the beginning of the ways of God, who made him; he will use him as his sword.
Job 40:20	The mountains bring forth grass for him; all the beasts of the field will play there.
Job 40:21	He sleeps in the shadows, under the cover of branches, and in moist places.
Job 40:22	The shadows cover his shadow; the willows of the brook will encircle him.
Job 40:23	Behold, he will drink a river and not be amazed, and he has confidence that the Jordan could flow into his mouth.
Job 40:24	He will seize him through his eyes, as if with a hook, and he will bore through his nostrils, as if with stakes.
Job 41:1	Can you draw out the leviathan with a hook, and can you bind his tongue with a cord?
Job 41:2	Can you place a ring in his nose, or bore through his jaw with an arm band?
Job 41:3	Will he offer many prayers to you, or speak to you quietly?
Job 41:4	Will he form a covenant with you, and will you accept him as a servant forever?
Job 41:5	Will you play with him as with a bird, or tether him for your handmaids?
Job 41:6	Will your friends cut him into pieces, will dealers distribute him?
Job 41:7	Will you fill up bags with his hide, and let his head be used as a home for fishes?
Job 41:8	Place your hand upon him; remember the battle and speak no more.
Job 41:9	Behold, his hope will fail him, and in the sight of all, he will be thrown down.
Job 41:10	I will not rouse him, as the cruel would do, for who is able to withstand my countenance?
Job 41:11	Who has given to me beforehand, so that I should repay him? All things that are under heaven are mine.
Job 41:12	I will not spare him, nor his powerful words and counterfeit attempts at supplication.
Job 41:13	Who can reveal the beauty of his garment? And who can enter the middle of his mouth?
Job 41:14	Who can open the doors of his face? I gave fear to the circle of his teeth.
Job 41:15	His body is like shields fused together, like dense scales pressed over one another.
Job 41:16	One is joined to another, and not even air can pass between them.
Job 41:17	They adhere to one another, and they hold themselves in place and will not be separated.
Job 41:18	His sneezing has the brilliance of fire, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
Job 41:19	Lamps proceed from his mouth, like torches of fire burning brightly.
Job 41:20	Smoke passes out of his nostrils, like a pot that is heated and boiling.
Job 41:21	His breath causes coal to burn, and a flame comes forth from his mouth.
Job 41:22	Strength dwells in his neck, and destitution goes before his presence.
Job 41:23	The parts of his body work in harmony together. He will send lightning bolts against him, and they will not be carried to another place.
Job 41:24	His heart will be as hard as a stone and as dense as a blacksmith’s anvil.
Job 41:25	When he will be raised up, the angels will be afraid, and, because they are terrified, they will purify themselves.
Job 41:26	When a sword catches up with him, it will not be able to settle in, nor a spear, nor a breastplate.
Job 41:27	For he will consider iron as if it were chaff, and brass as if it were rotten wood.
Job 41:28	The archer will not cause him to flee; the stones of the sling have been turned into stubble for him.
Job 41:29	He will treat the hammer as if it were stubble, and he will ridicule those who brandish the spear.
Job 41:30	The beams of the sun will be under him, and he will dispense gold to them as if it were clay.
Job 41:31	He will make the depths of the sea boil like a pot, and he will set it to bubble just as ointments do.
Job 41:32	A path will shine after him; he will esteem the abyss as if it were weakening with age.
Job 41:33	There is no power on the earth that is being compared to him, who has been made so that he fears no one.
Job 41:34	He sees every prominent thing; he is king over all the sons of arrogance.
Job 42:1	Then Job, responding to the Lord, said:
Job 42:2	I know that you are able to do all things, and that no thoughts are hidden from you.
Job 42:3	So, who is it that would disguise a lack of knowledge as counsel? Therefore, I have been speaking foolishly, about things whose measure exceeds my knowledge.
Job 42:4	Listen, and I will speak. I will question you, and you may answer me.
Job 42:5	By paying attention with the ear, I have heard you, but now my eye sees you.
Job 42:6	Therefore, I find myself reprehensible, and I will do penance in embers and ashes.
Job 42:7	But after the Lord had finished speaking these words to Job, he said to Eliphaz the Themanite: My wrath has been kindled against you, and against your two friends, because you have not been speaking correctly in my eyes, as my servant Job has done.
Job 42:8	Therefore, have seven bulls and seven rams brought to you, and go to my servant Job, and offer these as a holocaust for yourselves. But also, my servant Job will pray for you; I will accept his face, so that foolishness will not be imputed to you. For you have not been speaking correctly about me, as my servant Job has done.
Job 42:9	So Eliphaz the Themanite, and Baldad the Suhite, and Zophar the Naamathite departed, and they did just as the Lord had spoken to them, and the Lord accepted the face of Job.
Job 42:10	Likewise, the Lord was moved by the repentance of Job, when he prayed for his friends. And the Lord gave to Job twice as much as he had before.
Job 42:11	Yet all his brethren came to him, and all his sisters, and everyone who had known him before, and they ate bread with him in his house. They also shook their heads over him and comforted him, because of all the bad things that God had inflicted on him. And each one of them gave him one female sheep, and one earring of gold.
Job 42:12	And the Lord blessed the latter end of Job even more than his beginning. And he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand pairs of oxen, and a thousand she-donkeys.
Job 42:13	And he had seven sons and three daughters.
Job 42:14	And he called the name of one, Daylight, and the name of the second, Cinnamon, and the name of the third, Horn of Cosmetics.
Job 42:15	And, in the whole world, there were not found women so beautiful as the daughters of Job. And so their father gave them an inheritance along with their brothers.
Job 42:16	But Job lived long after these events, for a hundred and forty years, and he saw his children, and his children’s children, all the way to the fourth generation,
Job 42:17	and he died an old man and full of days.
Psalm 1:1	Blessed is the man who has not followed the counsel of the impious, and has not remained in the way of sinners, and has not sat in the chair of pestilence.
Psalm 1:2	But his will is with the law of the Lord, and he will meditate on his law, day and night.
Psalm 1:3	And he will be like a tree that has been planted beside running waters, which will provide its fruit in its time, and its leaf will not fall away, and all things whatsoever that he does will prosper.
Psalm 1:4	Not so the impious, not so. For they are like the dust that the wind casts along the face of the earth.
Psalm 1:5	Therefore, the impious will not prevail again in judgment, nor sinners in the council of the just.
Psalm 1:6	For the Lord knows the way of the just. And the path of the impious will pass away.
Psalm 2:1	Why have the Gentiles been seething, and why have the people been pondering nonsense?
Psalm 2:2	The kings of the earth have stood up, and the leaders have joined together as one, against the Lord and against his Christ:
Psalm 2:3	“Let us shatter their chains and cast their yoke away from us.”
Psalm 2:4	He who dwells in heaven will ridicule them, and the Lord will mock them.
Psalm 2:5	Then will he speak to them in his anger and trouble them with his fury.
Psalm 2:6	Yet I have been appointed king by him over Zion, his holy mountain, preaching his precepts.
Psalm 2:7	The Lord has said to me: You are my son, this day have I begotten you.
Psalm 2:8	Ask of me and I will give to you: the Gentiles for your inheritance, and the ends of the earth for your possession.
Psalm 2:9	You will rule them with an iron rod, and you will shatter them like a potter’s vessel.
Psalm 2:10	And now, O kings, understand. Receive instruction, you who judge the earth.
Psalm 2:11	Serve the Lord in fear, and exult in him with trembling.
Psalm 2:12	Embrace discipline, lest at any time the Lord might become angry, and you would perish from the way of the just. Though his wrath can flare up in a short time, blessed are all those who trust in him.
Psalm 3:1	A Psalm of David. When he fled from the face of his son, Absalom. Lord, why have those who trouble me been multiplied? Many rise up against me.
Psalm 3:2	Many say to my soul, “There is no salvation for him in his God.”
Psalm 3:3	But you, Lord, are my supporter, my glory, and the one who raises up my head.
Psalm 3:4	I have cried out to the Lord with my voice, and he has heard me from his holy mountain.
Psalm 3:5	I have slept, and I have been stupefied. But I awakened because the Lord has taken me up.
Psalm 3:6	I will not fear the thousands of people surrounding me. Rise up, Lord. Save me, my God.
Psalm 3:7	For you have struck all those who oppose me without cause. You have broken the teeth of sinners.
Psalm 3:8	Salvation is of the Lord, and your blessing is upon your people.
Psalm 4:1	In parts according to verses. A Psalm of David. When I called upon him, the God of my justice heeded me. In tribulation, you have enlarged me. Have mercy on me, and heed my prayer.
Psalm 4:2	Sons of men, how long will you be dull in heart, so that whatever you love is in vain, and whatever you seek is false?
Psalm 4:3	And know this: the Lord has made wondrous his holy one. The Lord will heed me when I cry out to him.
Psalm 4:4	Be angry, and do not be willing to sin. The things that you say in your hearts: be sorry for them on your beds.
Psalm 4:5	Offer the sacrifice of justice, and hope in the Lord. Many say, “Who reveals to us what is good?”
Psalm 4:6	The light of your countenance, Lord, has been sealed upon us. You have given joy to my heart.
Psalm 4:7	By the fruit of their grain, wine, and oil, they have been multiplied.
Psalm 4:8	In peace itself, I will sleep and I will rest. For you, O Lord, have established me singularly in hope.
Psalm 5:1	Unto the end. For her who pursues the inheritance. A Psalm of David. O Lord, listen closely to my words. Understand my outcry.
Psalm 5:2	Attend to the voice of my prayer, my King and my God.
Psalm 5:3	For to you, I will pray. In the morning, Lord, you will hear my voice.
Psalm 5:4	In the morning, I will stand before you, and I will see. For you are not a God who wills iniquity.
Psalm 5:5	And the malicious will not dwell close to you, nor will the unjust endure before your eyes.
Psalm 5:6	You hate all who work iniquity. You will destroy all who speak a lie. The bloody and deceitful man, the Lord will abominate.
Psalm 5:7	But I am in the multitude of your mercy. I will enter your house. I will show adoration toward your holy temple, in your fear.
Psalm 5:8	Lord, lead me in your justice. Because of my enemies, direct my way in your sight.
Psalm 5:9	For there is no truth in their mouth: their heart is vain.
Psalm 5:10	Their throat is an open sepulcher. They have acted deceitfully with their tongues. Judge them, O God. Let them fall by their own intentions: according to the multitude of their impiety, expel them. For they have provoked you, O Lord.
Psalm 5:11	But let all those who hope in you rejoice. They will exult in eternity, and you will dwell in them. And all those who love your name will glory in you.
Psalm 5:12	For you will bless the just. You have crowned us, O Lord, as if with a shield of your good will.
Psalm 6:1	In parts according to verses. A Psalm of David. For the octave. O Lord, do not rebuke me in your fury, nor chastise me in your anger.
Psalm 6:2	Have mercy on me, Lord, for I am weak. Heal me, Lord, for my bones have become disturbed,
Psalm 6:3	and my soul has been very troubled. But as for you, Lord, when?
Psalm 6:4	Turn to me, Lord, and rescue my soul. Save me because of your mercy.
Psalm 6:5	For there is no one in death who would be mindful of you. And who will confess to you in Hell?
Psalm 6:6	I have labored in my groaning. Every night, with my tears, I will wash my bed and drench my blanket.
Psalm 6:7	My eye has been troubled by rage. I have grown old among all my enemies.
Psalm 6:8	Scatter before me, all you who work iniquity, for the Lord has heard the voice of my weeping.
Psalm 6:9	The Lord has heard my supplication. The Lord has accepted my prayer.
Psalm 6:10	Let all my enemies be ashamed and together be greatly troubled. May they be converted and become ashamed very quickly.
Psalm 7:1	A Psalm of David, which he sang to the Lord because of the words of Cush, the son of Jemini. O Lord, my God, in you I have hoped. Save me from all those who persecute me, and free me:
Psalm 7:2	lest at any time, like a lion, he might seize my soul, while there is no one to redeem me, nor any who can save.
Psalm 7:3	O Lord, my God, if there is iniquity in my hands, if I have done this:
Psalm 7:4	if I have repaid those who rendered evils to me, may I deservedly fall away empty before my enemies:
Psalm 7:5	let the enemy pursue my soul, and take hold of it, and trample my life into the earth, and drag down my glory into the dust.
Psalm 7:6	Rise up, Lord, in your anger. And be exalted to the borders of my enemies. And rise up, O Lord my God, according to the precept that you commanded,
Psalm 7:7	and a congregation of people will surround you. And, because of this, return on high.
Psalm 7:8	The Lord judges the people. Judge me, O Lord, according to my justice and according to my innocence within me.
Psalm 7:9	The wickedness of sinners will be consumed, and you will direct the just: the examiner of hearts and temperaments is God.
Psalm 7:10	Just is my help from the Lord, who saves the upright of heart.
Psalm 7:11	God is a just judge, strong and patient. How could he be angry throughout every day?
Psalm 7:12	Unless you will be converted, he will brandish his sword. He has extended his bow and made it ready.
Psalm 7:13	And with it, he has prepared instruments of death. He has produced his arrows for those on fire.
Psalm 7:14	Behold him who has given birth to injustice: he has conceived sorrow and has begotten iniquity.
Psalm 7:15	He has opened a pit and enlarged it. And he has fallen into the hole that he made.
Psalm 7:16	His sorrow will be turned upon his own head, and his iniquity will descend upon his highest point.
Psalm 7:17	I will confess to the Lord according to his justice, and I will sing a psalm to the name of the Lord Most High.
Psalm 8:1	Unto the end. For the oil and wine presses. A Psalm of David. O Lord, our Lord, how admirable is your name throughout all the earth! For your magnificence is elevated above the heavens.
Psalm 8:2	Out of the mouths of babes and infants, you have perfected praise, because of your enemies, so that you may destroy the enemy and the revenger.
Psalm 8:3	For I will behold your heavens, the works of your fingers: the moon and the stars, which you have founded.
Psalm 8:4	What is man, that you are mindful of him, or the son of man, that you visit him?
Psalm 8:5	You reduced him to a little less than the Angels; you have crowned him with glory and honor,
Psalm 8:6	and you have set him over the works of your hands.
Psalm 8:7	You have subjected all things under his feet, all sheep and oxen, and in addition: the beasts of the field,
Psalm 8:8	the birds of the air, and the fish of the sea, which pass through the paths of the sea.
Psalm 8:9	O Lord, our Lord, how admirable is your name throughout all the earth!
Psalm 9:1	Unto the end. For the secrets of the Son. A Psalm of David. I will confess to you, Lord, with my whole heart. I will recount all your wonders.
Psalm 9:2	I will rejoice and exult in you. I will sing a psalm to your name, O Most High.
Psalm 9:3	For my enemy will be turned back. They will be weakened and perish before your face.
Psalm 9:4	For you have accomplished my judgment and my cause. You have sat upon the throne that judges justice.
Psalm 9:5	You have rebuked the Gentiles, and the impious one has perished. You have deleted their name in eternity and for all generations.
Psalm 9:6	The spears of the enemy have failed in the end, and their cities, you have destroyed. Their memory has perished with a loud noise.
Psalm 9:7	But the Lord remains in eternity. He has prepared his throne in judgment.
Psalm 9:8	And he will judge the whole world in equity. He will judge the people in justice.
Psalm 9:9	And the Lord has become a refuge for the poor, a helper in opportunity, in tribulation.
Psalm 9:10	And may they hope in you, who know your name. For you have not abandoned those seeking you, Lord.
Psalm 9:11	Sing a psalm to the Lord, who dwells in Zion. Announce his study among the Gentiles.
Psalm 9:12	Because of those who yearned for their blood, he has remembered them. He has not forgotten the cry of the poor.
Psalm 9:13	Have mercy on me, Lord. See my humiliation from my enemies.
Psalm 9:14	You lift me up from the gates of death, so that I may announce all your praises at the gates of the daughter of Zion.
Psalm 9:15	I will exult in your salvation. The Gentiles have become trapped in the ruin that they made. Their foot has been caught in the same snare that they themselves had hidden.
Psalm 9:16	The Lord will be recognized when making judgments. The sinner has been caught in the works of his own hands.
Psalm 9:17	The sinners will be turned into Hell: all the Gentiles who have forgotten God.
Psalm 9:18	For the poor will not be forgotten in the end. The patience of the poor will not perish in the end.
Psalm 9:19	Rise up, Lord: do not let man be strengthened. Let the Gentiles be judged in your sight.
Psalm 9:20	O Lord, establish a lawgiver over them, so that the Gentiles may know that they are only men.
Psalm 10:1	So then, why, O Lord, have you withdrawn far away? Why have you overlooked us in opportunity, in tribulation?
Psalm 10:2	While the impious is arrogant, the poor is enflamed. They are held by the counsels that they devise.
Psalm 10:3	For the sinner is praised by the desires of his soul, and the iniquitous is blessed.
Psalm 10:4	The sinner has provoked the Lord; according to the multitude of his wrath, he will not seek him.
Psalm 10:5	God is not before his sight. His ways are stained at all times. Your judgments are removed from his face. He will be master of all his enemies.
Psalm 10:6	For he has said in his heart, “I will not be disturbed: from generation to generation without evil.”
Psalm 10:7	His mouth is full of curses, and bitterness, and deceit. Under his tongue are hardship and sorrow.
Psalm 10:8	He sits in ambush, with resources in hidden places, so that he may execute the innocent.
Psalm 10:9	His eyes catch sight of the poor. He lies in ambush, in hiding like a lion in his den. He lies in ambush, so that he may seize the poor, to seize the poor as he draws him in.
Psalm 10:10	With his snare, he will bring him down. He will crouch down and pounce, when he has power over the poor.
Psalm 10:11	For he has said in his heart, “God has forgotten, he has turned away his face, lest he see to the end.”
Psalm 10:12	O Lord God, rise up. Let your hand be exalted. Do not forget the poor.
Psalm 10:13	How has the impious one provoked God? For he has said in his heart, “He will not inquire.”
Psalm 10:14	You do see, for you examine hardship and sorrow, so that you may deliver them into your hands. The poor one has been abandoned to you. You will be a helper to the orphan.
Psalm 10:15	Break the arm of the sinner and the malicious. His sin will be sought, and it will not be found.
Psalm 10:16	The Lord shall reign in eternity, even forever and ever. You will perish the Gentiles from his land.

Psalm 10:18	so as to judge for the orphan and the humble, so that man may no longer presume to magnify himself upon the earth.
Psalm 11:1	Unto the end. A Psalm of David. I trust in the Lord. How can you say to my soul, “Sojourn to the mountain, like a sparrow.”
Psalm 11:2	For behold, the sinners have bent their bow. They have prepared their arrows in the quiver, so as to shoot arrows in the dark at the upright of heart.
Psalm 11:3	For they have destroyed the things that you have completed. But what has the just one done?
Psalm 11:4	The Lord is in his holy temple. The Lord’s throne is in heaven. His eyes look upon the poor. His eyelids question the sons of men.
Psalm 11:5	The Lord questions the just and the impious. Yet he who loves iniquity, hates his own soul.
Psalm 11:6	He will rain down snares upon sinners. Fire and brimstone and windstorms will be the portion of their cup.
Psalm 11:7	For the Lord is just, and he has chosen justice. His countenance has beheld equity.
Psalm 12:1	Unto the end. For the octave. A Psalm of David. Save me, O Lord, because holiness has passed away, because truths have been diminished, before the sons of men.

Psalm 12:3	May the Lord scatter all deceitful lips, along with the tongue that speaks malice.

Psalm 12:6	The eloquence of the Lord is pure eloquence, silver tested by fire, purged from the earth, refined seven times.
Psalm 12:7	You, O Lord, will preserve us, and you will guard us from this generation into eternity.
Psalm 12:8	The impious wander aimlessly. According to your loftiness, you have multiplied the sons of men.

Psalm 13:3	How long will my enemy be exalted over me?
Psalm 13:4	Look upon me and listen to me, O Lord my God. Enlighten my eyes, lest I fall asleep forever in death,
Psalm 13:5	lest at any time my enemy may say, “I have prevailed against him.” Those who trouble me will exult, if I have been disturbed.
Psalm 13:6	But I have hoped in your mercy. My heart will exult in your salvation. I will sing to the Lord, who assigns good things to me. And I will sing psalms to the name of the Lord Most High.
Psalm 14:1	Unto the end. A Psalm of David. The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” They were corrupted, and they have become abominable in their studies. There is no one who does good; there is not even one.
Psalm 14:2	The Lord has looked down from heaven upon the sons of men, to see if there were any who were considering or seeking God.
Psalm 14:3	They have all gone astray; together they have become useless. There is no one who does good; there is not even one. Their throat is an open sepulcher. With their tongues, they have been acting deceitfully; the venom of asps is under their lips. Their mouth is full of curses and bitterness. Their feet are swift to shed blood. Grief and unhappiness are in their ways; and the way of peace, they have not known. There is no fear of God before their eyes.
Psalm 14:4	Will they never learn: all those who work iniquity, who devour my people like a meal of bread?
Psalm 14:5	They have not called upon the Lord. There, they have trembled in fear, where there was no fear.
Psalm 14:6	For the Lord is with the just generation. You have confounded the counsel of the needy because the Lord is his hope.
Psalm 14:7	Who will grant the salvation of Israel from Zion? When the Lord turns away the captivity of his people, Jacob will exult, and Israel will rejoice.
Psalm 15:1	A Psalm of David. O Lord, who will dwell in your tabernacle? Or who will rest on your holy mountain?
Psalm 15:2	He who walks without blemish and who works justice.
Psalm 15:3	He who speaks the truth in his heart, who has not acted deceitfully with his tongue, and has not done evil to his neighbor, and has not taken up a reproach against his neighbors.
Psalm 15:4	In his sight, the malicious one has been reduced to nothing, but he glorifies those who fear the Lord. He who swears to his neighbor and does not deceive.
Psalm 15:5	He who has not given his money in usury, nor accepted bribes against the innocent. He who does these things will be undisturbed for eternity.

Psalm 16:6	The lots have fallen upon me with clarity. And, indeed, my inheritance has been very clear to me.

Psalm 16:8	I have made provision for the Lord always in my sight. For he is at my right hand, so that I may not be disturbed.
Psalm 16:9	Because of this, my heart has been joyful, and my tongue has exulted. Moreover, even my body will rest in hope.

Psalm 17:5	Perfect my steps in your paths, so that my footsteps may not be disturbed.
Psalm 17:6	I have cried out because you, O God, have listened to me. Incline your ear to me and heed my words.

Psalm 18:1	Unto the end. For David, the servant of the Lord, who spoke the words of this canticle to the Lord, in the day that the Lord delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul. And he said: I will love you, O Lord my strength.
Psalm 18:2	The Lord is my firmament, my refuge, and my liberator. My God is my helper, and I hope in him: my protector, and the horn of my salvation, and my support.
Psalm 18:3	Praising, I will call upon the Lord. And I will be saved from my enemies.
Psalm 18:4	The sorrows of death surrounded me, and the torrents of iniquity dismayed me.
Psalm 18:5	The sorrows of Hell encompassed me, and the snares of death intercepted me.
Psalm 18:6	In my tribulation, I called upon the Lord, and I cried out to my God. And he listened to my voice from his holy temple. And my cry in his presence entered into his ears.
Psalm 18:7	The earth was shaken, and it trembled. The foundations of the mountains were disturbed, and they were shaken, because he was angry with them.
Psalm 18:8	A smoke ascended by his wrath, and a fire flared up from his face: coals were kindled by it.
Psalm 18:9	He bent the heavens, and they descended. And darkness was under his feet.
Psalm 18:10	And he ascended upon the cherubim, and he flew: he flew upon the feathers of the winds.
Psalm 18:11	And he set darkness as his hiding place, with his tabernacle all around him: dark waters in the clouds of the air.
Psalm 18:12	At the brightness that was before his sight, the clouds crossed by, with hail and coals of fire.
Psalm 18:13	And the Lord thundered from heaven, and the Most High uttered his voice: hail and coals of fire.
Psalm 18:14	And he sent forth his arrows and scattered them. He multiplied lightnings, and he set them in disarray.
Psalm 18:15	Then the fountains of waters appeared, and the foundations of the world were revealed, by your rebuke, O Lord, by the inspiration of the Spirit of your wrath.
Psalm 18:16	He sent from on high, and he accepted me. And he took me up, out of many waters.
Psalm 18:17	He rescued me from my strongest enemies, and from those who hated me. For they had been too strong for me.
Psalm 18:18	They intercepted me in the day of my affliction, and the Lord became my protector.
Psalm 18:19	And he led me out, into a wide place. He accomplished my salvation, because he willed me.
Psalm 18:20	And the Lord will reward me according to my justice, and he will repay me according to the purity of my hands.
Psalm 18:21	For I have preserved the ways of the Lord, and I have not behaved impiously before my God.
Psalm 18:22	For all his judgments are in my sight, and his justice, I have not pushed away from me.
Psalm 18:23	And I will be immaculate together with him, and I will keep myself from my iniquity.
Psalm 18:24	And the Lord will reward me according to my justice and according to the purity of my hands before his eyes.
Psalm 18:25	With the holy, you will be holy, and with the innocent, you will be innocent,
Psalm 18:26	and with the elect, you will be elect, and with the perverse, you will be perverse.
Psalm 18:27	For you will save the humble people, but you will bring down the eyes of the arrogant.
Psalm 18:28	For you illuminate my lamp, O Lord. My God, enlighten my darkness.
Psalm 18:29	For in you, I will be delivered from temptation; and with my God, I will climb over a wall.
Psalm 18:30	As for my God, his way is undefiled. The eloquence of the Lord has been examined by fire. He is the protector of all who hope in him.
Psalm 18:31	For who is God, except the Lord? And who is God, except our God?
Psalm 18:32	It is God who has wrapped me with virtue and made my way immaculate.
Psalm 18:33	It is he who has perfected my feet, like the feet of deer, and who stations me upon the heights.
Psalm 18:34	It is he who trains my hands for battle. And you have set my arms like a bow of brass.
Psalm 18:35	And you have given me the protection of your salvation. And your right hand sustains me. And your discipline has corrected me unto the end. And your discipline itself will teach me.
Psalm 18:36	You have expanded my footsteps under me, and my tracks have not been weakened.
Psalm 18:37	I will pursue my enemies and apprehend them. And I will not turn back until they have failed.
Psalm 18:38	I will break them, and they will not be able to stand. They will fall under my feet.
Psalm 18:39	And you have wrapped me with virtue for the battle. And those rising up against me, you have subdued under me.
Psalm 18:40	And you have given the back of my enemies to me, and you have destroyed those who hated me.
Psalm 18:41	They cried out, but there was none to save them, to the Lord, but he did not heed them.
Psalm 18:42	And I will crush them into dust before the face of the wind, so that I will obliterate them like the mud in the streets.
Psalm 18:43	You will rescue me from the contradictions of the people. You will set me at the head of the Gentiles.
Psalm 18:44	A people I did not know has served me. As soon as their ears heard, they were obedient to me.
Psalm 18:45	The sons of foreigners have been deceitful to me, the sons of foreigners have grown weak with time, and they have wavered from their paths.
Psalm 18:46	The Lord lives, and blessed is my God, and may the God of my salvation be exalted:
Psalm 18:47	O God, who vindicates me and who subdues the people under me, my liberator from my enraged enemies.
Psalm 18:48	And you will exalt me above those who rise up against me. From the iniquitous man, you will rescue me.
Psalm 18:49	Because of this, O Lord, I will confess to you among the nations, and I will compose a psalm to your name:
Psalm 18:50	magnifying the salvation of his king, and showing mercy to David, his Christ, and to his offspring, even for all time.

Psalm 19:2	Day proclaims the word to day, and night to night imparts knowledge.
Psalm 19:3	There are no speeches or conversations, where their voices are not being heard.
Psalm 19:4	Their sound has gone forth through all the earth, and their words to the ends of the world.
Psalm 19:5	He has placed his tabernacle in the sun, and he is like a bridegroom coming out of his bedroom. He has exulted like a giant running along the way;
Psalm 19:6	his departure is from the summit of heaven. And his course reaches all the way to its summit. Neither is there anyone who can hide himself from his heat.
Psalm 19:7	The law of the Lord is immaculate, converting souls. The testimony of the Lord is faithful, providing wisdom to little ones.
Psalm 19:8	The justice of the Lord is right, rejoicing hearts. The precepts of the Lord are brilliant, enlightening the eyes.
Psalm 19:9	The fear of the Lord is holy, enduring for all generations. The judgments of the Lord are true, justified in themselves:
Psalm 19:10	desirable beyond gold and many precious stones, and sweeter than honey and the honeycomb.
Psalm 19:11	For, indeed, your servant keeps them, and in keeping them, there are many rewards.
Psalm 19:12	Who can understand transgression? From my hidden faults, cleanse me, O Lord,
Psalm 19:13	and from those of others, spare your servant. If they will have no dominion over me, then I will be immaculate, and I will be cleansed from the greatest transgression.
Psalm 19:14	And the eloquence of my mouth will be so as to please, along with the meditation of my heart, in your sight, forever, O Lord, my helper and my redeemer.

Psalm 27:13	I believe that I shall see the good things of the Lord in the land of the living.

Psalm 28:1	A Psalm of David himself. To you, Lord, I will cry out. My God, do not be silent toward me. For if you remain silent toward me, I will become like those who descend into the pit.
Psalm 28:2	Hear, O Lord, the voice of my supplication, when I pray to you, when I lift up my hands toward your holy temple.
Psalm 28:3	Do not draw me away together with sinners; and let me not perish with those who work iniquity, who speak peacefully to their neighbor, yet evils are in their hearts.
Psalm 28:4	Give to them according to their works and according to the wickedness of their inventions. Assign to them according to the works of their hands. Repay them with their own retribution.
Psalm 28:5	Since they have not understood the works of the Lord and the works of his hands, you will destroy them, and you will not build them up.
Psalm 28:6	Blessed is the Lord, for he has heard the voice of my supplication.
Psalm 28:7	The Lord is my helper and my protector. In him, my heart has hoped and I have been helped. And my flesh has flourished again. And from my will, I shall confess to him.
Psalm 28:8	The Lord is the strength of his people and the protector of the salvation of his Christ.
Psalm 28:9	O Lord, save your people and bless your inheritance, and reign over them and exalt them, even unto eternity.
Psalm 29:1	A Psalm of David, at the completion of the tabernacle. Bring to the Lord, O sons of God, bring to the Lord the sons of rams.
Psalm 29:2	Bring to the Lord, glory and honor. Bring to the Lord, glory for his name. Adore the Lord in his holy court.
Psalm 29:3	The voice of the Lord is over the waters. The God of majesty has thundered. The Lord is over many waters.
Psalm 29:4	The voice of the Lord is in virtue. The voice of the Lord is in magnificence.
Psalm 29:5	The voice of the Lord shatters the cedars. And the Lord will shatter the cedars of Lebanon.
Psalm 29:6	And it will break them into pieces, like a calf of Lebanon, and in the same way as the beloved son of the single-horned beast.
Psalm 29:7	The voice of the Lord cuts through the flame of fire.
Psalm 29:8	The voice of the Lord shakes the desert. And the Lord will quake the desert of Kadesh.
Psalm 29:9	The voice of the Lord is preparing the stags, and he will reveal the dense woods. And in his temple, all will speak his glory.
Psalm 29:10	The Lord causes the great flood to dwell. And the Lord will sit as King in eternity.
Psalm 29:11	The Lord will give virtue to his people. The Lord will bless his people in peace.
Psalm 30:1	A Canticle Psalm. In dedication to the house of David. I will extol you, Lord, for you have sustained me, and you have not allowed my enemies to delight over me.
Psalm 30:2	O Lord my God, I have cried out to you, and you have healed me.
Psalm 30:3	Lord, you led my soul away from Hell. You have saved me from those who descend into the pit.
Psalm 30:4	Sing a psalm to the Lord, you his saints, and confess with remembrance of his holiness.
Psalm 30:5	For wrath is in his indignation, and life is in his will. Toward evening, weeping will linger, and toward morning, gladness.
Psalm 30:6	But I have said in my abundance: “I will never be disturbed.”
Psalm 30:7	O Lord, in your will, you made virtue preferable to beauty for me. You turned your face away from me, and I became disturbed.
Psalm 30:8	To you, Lord, I will cry out. And I will make supplication to my God.
Psalm 30:9	What use would there be in my blood, if I descend into corruption? Will dust confess to you or announce your truth?
Psalm 30:10	The Lord has heard, and he has been merciful to me. The Lord has become my helper.
Psalm 30:11	You have turned my mourning into gladness for me. You have cut off my sackcloth, and you have surrounded me with joy.
Psalm 30:12	So then, may my glory sing to you, and may I not regret it. O Lord, my God, I will confess to you for eternity.
Psalm 31:1	Unto the end. A Psalm of David according to an ecstasy. In you, Lord, I have hoped; let me never be confounded. In your justice, deliver me.
Psalm 31:2	Incline your ear to me. Hasten to rescue me. Be for me a protector God and a house of refuge, so as to accomplish my salvation.
Psalm 31:3	For you are my strength and my refuge; and for the sake of your name, you will lead me and nourish me.
Psalm 31:4	You will lead me out of this snare, which they have hidden for me. For you are my protector.
Psalm 31:5	Into your hands, I commend my spirit. You have redeemed me, O Lord, God of truth.
Psalm 31:6	You have hated those who practice emptiness to no purpose. But I have hoped in the Lord.
Psalm 31:7	I will exult and rejoice in your mercy. For you have looked upon my humility; you have saved my soul from needfulness.
Psalm 31:8	And you have not enclosed me in the hands of the enemy. You have set my feet in a spacious place.
Psalm 31:9	Have mercy on me, Lord, for I am troubled. My eye has been disturbed by wrath, along with my soul and my gut.
Psalm 31:10	For my life has fallen into sorrow, and my years into sighing. My virtue has been weakened in poverty, and my bones have been disturbed.
Psalm 31:11	I have become a disgrace among all my enemies, and even more so to my neighbors, and a dread to my acquaintances. Those who catch sight of me, flee away from me.
Psalm 31:12	I have become forgotten, like one dead to the heart. I have become like a damaged utensil.
Psalm 31:13	For I have heard the harsh criticism of many who linger in the area. While assembled together against me in that place, they deliberated on how to take away my life.
Psalm 31:14	But I have hoped in you, O Lord. I said, “You are my God.”
Psalm 31:15	My fate is in your hands. Rescue me from the hand of my enemies and from those who are persecuting me.
Psalm 31:16	Shine your face upon your servant. Save me in your mercy.
Psalm 31:17	Do not let me be confounded, Lord, for I have called upon you. Let the impious be ashamed and be drawn down into Hell.
Psalm 31:18	May deceitful lips be silenced: those that speak iniquity against the just, in arrogance and in abusiveness.
Psalm 31:19	How great is the multitude of your sweetness, O Lord, which you keep hidden for those who fear you, which you have perfected for those who hope in you, in the sight of the sons of men.
Psalm 31:20	You hide them in the concealment of your face, from the disturbance of men. You protect them in your tabernacle, from the contradiction of tongues.
Psalm 31:21	Blessed is the Lord. For he has shown his wonderful mercy to me, in a fortified city.
Psalm 31:22	But I said in the excess of my mind: “I have been cast away from the glance of your eyes.” And so, you heeded the voice of my prayer, while I was still crying out to you.
Psalm 31:23	Love the Lord, all you his saints. For the Lord will require truth, and he will abundantly repay those who act with arrogance.
Psalm 31:24	Act manfully, and let your heart be strengthened, all you who hope in the Lord.
Psalm 32:1	The understanding of David himself. Blessed are they whose iniquities have been forgiven and whose sins have been covered.
Psalm 32:2	Blessed is the man to whom the Lord has not imputed sin, and in whose spirit there is no deceit.
Psalm 32:3	Because I was silent, my bones grew old, while still I cried out all day long.
Psalm 32:4	For, day and night, your hand was heavy upon me. I have been converted in my anguish, while still the thorn is piercing.
Psalm 32:5	I have acknowledged my offense to you, and I have not concealed my injustice. I said, “I will confess against myself, my injustice to the Lord,” and you forgave the impiety of my sin.
Psalm 32:6	For this, everyone who is holy will pray to you in due time. Yet truly, in a flood of many waters, they will not draw near to him.
Psalm 32:7	You are my refuge from the tribulation that has surrounded me. You are my exultation: rescue me from those who are surrounding me.
Psalm 32:8	I will give you understanding, and I will instruct you in this way, in which you will walk. I will fix my eyes upon you.
Psalm 32:9	Do not become like the horse and the mule, which have no understanding. Their jaws are constrained with bit and bridle, so as not to draw near to you.
Psalm 32:10	Many are the scourges of the sinner, but mercy will surround him that hopes in the Lord.
Psalm 32:11	Rejoice in the Lord and exult, you just ones, and glory, all you upright of heart.
Psalm 33:1	A Psalm of David. Exult in the Lord, you just ones; together praise the upright.
Psalm 33:2	Confess to the Lord with stringed instruments; sing psalms to him with the psaltery, the instrument of ten strings.
Psalm 33:3	Sing to him a new song. Sing psalms to him skillfully, with loud exclamation.
Psalm 33:4	For the word of the Lord is upright, and all his works are in faith.
Psalm 33:5	He loves mercy and judgment. The earth is full of the mercy of the Lord.
Psalm 33:6	By the word of the Lord, the heavens were established, and all their power, by the Spirit of his mouth:
Psalm 33:7	gathering together the waters of the sea, as if in a container, placing the depths in storage.
Psalm 33:8	Let all the earth fear the Lord, and may all the inhabitants of the world quake before him.
Psalm 33:9	For he spoke, and they became. He commanded, and they were created.
Psalm 33:10	The Lord scatters the counsels of the nations. Moreover, he reproves the thoughts of the people, and he rejects the counsels of the leaders.
Psalm 33:11	But the counsel of the Lord remains for eternity, the thoughts of his heart from generation to generation.
Psalm 33:12	Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord, the people whom he has chosen as his inheritance.
Psalm 33:13	The Lord has looked down from heaven. He has seen all the sons of men.
Psalm 33:14	From his well-prepared dwelling place, he has gazed upon all who dwell on the earth.
Psalm 33:15	He has formed the hearts of each one of them; he understands all their works.
Psalm 33:16	The king is not saved by great power, nor will the giant be saved by his many powers.
Psalm 33:17	The horse is false safety; for he will not be saved by the abundance of his powers.
Psalm 33:18	Behold, the eyes of the Lord are on those who fear him and on those who hope in his mercy,
Psalm 33:19	so as to rescue their souls from death and to feed them during famine.
Psalm 33:20	Our soul remains with the Lord. For he is our helper and protector.
Psalm 33:21	For in him, our heart will rejoice, and in his holy name, we have hoped.
Psalm 33:22	Let your mercy be upon us, O Lord, just as we have hoped in you.
Psalm 34:1	To David, when he changed his appearance in the sight of Abimelech, and so he dismissed him, and he went away. I will bless the Lord at all times. His praise will be ever in my mouth.
Psalm 34:2	In the Lord, my soul will be praised. May the meek listen and rejoice.
Psalm 34:3	Magnify the Lord with me, and let us extol his name in itself.
Psalm 34:4	I sought the Lord, and he heeded me, and he carried me away from all my tribulations.
Psalm 34:5	Approach him and be enlightened, and your faces will not be confounded.

Psalm 34:8	Taste and see that the Lord is sweet. Blessed is the man who hopes in him.
Psalm 34:9	Fear the Lord, all you his saints. For there is no destitution for those who fear him.

Psalm 34:12	Which is the man who wills life, who chooses to see good days?

Psalm 35:1	Of David himself. O Lord, judge those who harm me; assail those who attack me.
Psalm 35:2	Take hold of weapons and a shield, and rise up in assistance to me.
Psalm 35:3	Bring forth the spear, and close in on those who persecute me. Say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
Psalm 35:4	Let them be confounded and in awe, who pursue my soul. Let them be turned back and be confounded, who think up evil against me.
Psalm 35:5	May they become like dust before the face of the wind, and let the Angel of the Lord hem them in.
Psalm 35:6	May their way become dark and slippery, and may the Angel of the Lord pursue them.
Psalm 35:7	For, without cause, they have concealed their snare for me unto destruction. Over nothing, they have rebuked my soul.
Psalm 35:8	Let the snare, of which he is ignorant, come upon him, and let the deception, which he has hidden, take hold of him: and may he fall into that very snare.
Psalm 35:9	But my soul will exult in the Lord and delight over his salvation.
Psalm 35:10	All my bones will say, “Lord, who is like you?” He rescues the needy from the hand of the stronger one, the indigent and the poor from those who plunder him.
Psalm 35:11	Unfair witnesses have risen up, interrogating me about things of which I am ignorant.
Psalm 35:12	They repaid me evil for good, to the deprivation of my soul.
Psalm 35:13	But as for me, when they were harassing me, I was clothed with haircloth. I humbled my soul with fasting, and my prayer will become my sinews.
Psalm 35:14	Like a neighbor, and like our brother, so did I please; like one mourning and contrite, so was I humbled.
Psalm 35:15	And they have been joyful against me, and they joined together. Scourges have been gathered over me, and I was ignorant of it.
Psalm 35:16	They have been scattered, yet they were unremorseful. They have tested me. They scoffed at me with scorn. They gnashed their teeth over me.
Psalm 35:17	Lord, when will you look down upon me? Restore my soul from before their malice, my only one from before the lions.
Psalm 35:18	I will confess to you in a great Church. I will praise you among a weighty people.
Psalm 35:19	May those who are my unjust adversaries not be glad over me: those who have hated me without cause, and who nod agreement with their eyes.
Psalm 35:20	For indeed, they spoke peacefully to me; and speaking with passion to the earth, they intended deceit.
Psalm 35:21	And they opened their mouth wide over me. They said, “Well, well, our eyes have seen.”
Psalm 35:22	You have seen, O Lord, do not be silent. Lord, do not depart from me.
Psalm 35:23	Rise up and be attentive to my judgment, to my cause, my God and my Lord.
Psalm 35:24	Judge me according to your justice, O Lord, my God, and do not let them be glad over me.
Psalm 35:25	Do not let them say in their hearts, “Well, well, to our soul.” Neither let them say, “We have devoured him.”
Psalm 35:26	Let them blush and be in awe together, those who congratulate at my misfortunes. Let them be clothed with confusion and awe, who speak great things against me.
Psalm 35:27	Let them exult and rejoice, who wish my justice, and let them ever say, “The Lord be magnified,” who will the peace of his servant.
Psalm 35:28	And so my tongue will express your justice: your praise all day long.

Psalm 36:2	For he has acted deceitfully in his sight, such that his iniquity will be found to be hatred.
Psalm 36:3	The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit. He is unwilling to understand, so that he may act well.
Psalm 36:4	He has been considering iniquity on his bed. He has set himself on every way that is not good; moreover, he has not hated evil.
Psalm 36:5	Lord, your mercy is in heaven, and your truth is even to the clouds.

Psalm 36:7	How you have multiplied your mercy, O God! And so the sons of men will hope under the cover of your wings.
Psalm 36:8	They will be inebriated with the fruitfulness of your house, and you will give them to drink from the torrent of your enjoyment.
Psalm 36:9	For with you is the fountain of life; and within your light, we will see the light.

Psalm 37:1	A Psalm of David himself. Do not choose to imitate the malicious; neither should you envy those who work iniquity.
Psalm 37:2	For they will quickly wither away like dry grass, and in like manner to kitchen herbs, they will soon droop.
Psalm 37:3	Hope in the Lord and do good, and dwell in the land, and so you shall be pastured with its riches.
Psalm 37:4	Delight in the Lord, and he will grant to you the petitions of your heart.
Psalm 37:5	Reveal your way to the Lord, and hope in him, and he will accomplish it.
Psalm 37:6	And he will bring forth your justice like the light, and your judgment like the midday.
Psalm 37:7	Be subject to the Lord and pray to him. Do not choose to compete with him who prospers in his way, with the man who does injustice.
Psalm 37:8	Cease from wrath and leave behind rage. Do not choose to imitate the malicious.
Psalm 37:9	For those who are malicious will be exterminated. But those who remain with the Lord, these will inherit the land.
Psalm 37:10	Yet still a little while, and the sinner will not be. And you will search his place and find nothing.
Psalm 37:11	But the meek shall inherit the earth, and they will delight in the multitude of peace.
Psalm 37:12	The sinner will observe the just, and he will gnash his teeth over him.
Psalm 37:13	But the Lord will laugh at him: for he knows in advance that his day will come.
Psalm 37:14	The sinners have drawn the sword, they have bent their bow, so as to cast down the poor and the needy, so as to massacre the upright of heart.
Psalm 37:15	Let their sword enter into their own hearts, and let their bow be broken.
Psalm 37:16	A little is better to the just than the many riches of sinners.
Psalm 37:17	For the arms of sinners will be crushed, but the Lord confirms the just.
Psalm 37:18	The Lord knows the days of the immaculate, and their inheritance will be in eternity.
Psalm 37:19	They will not be confounded in an evil time; and in days of famine, they will be satisfied:
Psalm 37:20	for sinners will perish. Truly, the adversaries of the Lord, soon after they have been honored and exalted, will fade away, in the same way that smoke fades away.
Psalm 37:21	The sinner will lend and not release, but the just one shows compassion and donates.
Psalm 37:22	For those who bless him will inherit the earth, but those who curse him will perish.
Psalm 37:23	The steps of a man will be directed by the Lord, and he will choose his way.
Psalm 37:24	When he falls, he will not be harmed, because the Lord places his hand under him.
Psalm 37:25	I have been young, and now I am old; and I have not seen the just forsaken, nor his offspring seeking bread.
Psalm 37:26	He shows compassion and lends, all day long, and his offspring will be in blessing.
Psalm 37:27	Turn away from evil and do good, and dwell forever and ever.
Psalm 37:28	For the Lord loves judgment, and he will not abandon his saints. They will be kept safe in eternity. The unjust will be punished, and the offspring of the impious will perish.
Psalm 37:29	But the just will inherit the earth, and they will dwell upon it forever and ever.
Psalm 37:30	The mouth of the just one will express wisdom, and his tongue will speak judgment.
Psalm 37:31	The law of his God is in his heart, and his steps shall not be supplanted.
Psalm 37:32	The sinner considers the just one and seeks to put him to death.
Psalm 37:33	But the Lord will not abandon him into his hands, nor condemn him, when he will be judged.
Psalm 37:34	Wait for the Lord, and keep to his way. And he will exalt you, so as to inherit the land that you may seize. When the sinners will have passed away, then you shall see.
Psalm 37:35	I have seen the impious over-exalted, and lifted up like the cedars of Lebanon.
Psalm 37:36	And I passed by, and behold, he was not. And I sought him, and his place was not found.
Psalm 37:37	Keep to innocence, and gaze upon fairness: because there are allotments for the peaceful man.
Psalm 37:38	But the unjust will be destroyed together: the allotments of the impious will pass away.
Psalm 37:39	But the salvation of the just is from the Lord, and he is their protector in time of tribulation.
Psalm 37:40	And the Lord will help them and free them. And he will rescue them from sinners and save them, because they have hoped in him.
Psalm 38:1	A Psalm of David, in commemoration of the Sabbath. O Lord, do not rebuke me in your fury, nor chastise me in your wrath.
Psalm 38:2	For your arrows have been driven into me, and your hand has been confirmed over me.
Psalm 38:3	There is no health in my flesh before the face of your wrath. There is no peace for my bones before the face of my sins.
Psalm 38:4	For my iniquities have walked over my head, and they have been like a heavy burden weighing upon me.
Psalm 38:5	My sores have putrefied and been corrupted before the face of my foolishness.
Psalm 38:6	I have become miserable, and I have been bent down, even to the end. I have walked with contrition all day long.
Psalm 38:7	For my loins have been filled with illusions, and there is no health in my flesh.

Psalm 38:9	O Lord, all my desire is before you, and my groaning before you has not been hidden.
Psalm 38:10	My heart has been disturbed. My strength has abandoned me, and the light of my eyes has abandoned me, and it is not with me.
Psalm 38:11	My friends and my neighbors have drawn near and stood against me. And those who were next to me stood far apart. And those who sought my soul used violence.
Psalm 38:12	And those who sought evil accusations against me were speaking emptiness. And they practiced deceitfulness all day long.
Psalm 38:13	But, like someone deaf, I did not hear. And I was like someone mute, not opening his mouth.
Psalm 38:14	And I became like a man who does not hear, and who has no reproofs in his mouth.
Psalm 38:15	For in you, Lord, I have hoped. You will listen to me, O Lord my God.
Psalm 38:16	For I said, “Lest at any time, my enemies might rejoice over me,” and, “While my feet are being shaken, they have spoken great things against me.”
Psalm 38:17	For I have been prepared for scourges, and my sorrow is ever before me.
Psalm 38:18	For I will announce my iniquity, and I will think about my sin.
