Psalm 38:21	Do not forsake me, O Lord my God. Do not depart from me.
Psalm 38:22	Be attentive to my help, O Lord, the God of my salvation.
Psalm 39:1	Unto the end. For Jeduthun himself. A Canticle of David. I said, “I will keep to my ways, so that I will not offend with my tongue.” I posted a guard at my mouth, when a sinner took up a position against me.
Psalm 39:2	I was silenced and humbled, and I was quiet before good things, and my sorrow was renewed.
Psalm 39:3	My heart grew hot within me, and, during my meditation, a fire would flare up.
Psalm 39:4	I spoke with my tongue, “O Lord, make me know my end, and what the number of my days will be, so that I may know what is lacking to me.”
Psalm 39:5	Behold, you have made my days measurable, and, before you, my substance is as nothing. Yet truly, all things are vanity: every living man.
Psalm 39:6	So then, truly man passes by like an image; even so, he is disquieted in vain. He stores up, and he knows not for whom he will gather these things.
Psalm 39:7	And now, what is it that awaits me? Is it not the Lord? And my substance is with you.
Psalm 39:8	Rescue me from all my iniquities. You have handed me over as reproach to the foolish.
Psalm 39:9	I was silenced, and I did not open my mouth, because it was you who acted.
Psalm 39:10	Remove your scourges from me.
Psalm 39:11	I fall short at corrections from the strength of your hand. For you have chastised man for iniquity. And you have made his soul shrink away like a spider. Nevertheless, it is in vain that any man be disquieted.
Psalm 39:12	O Lord, heed my prayer and my supplication. Pay attention to my tears. Do not be silent. For I am a newcomer with you, and a sojourner, just as all my fathers were.
Psalm 39:13	Forgive me, so that I may be refreshed, before I will go forth and be no more.
Psalm 40:1	Unto the end. A Psalm of David himself. I have waited expectantly for the Lord, and he was attentive to me.
Psalm 40:2	And he heard my prayers and he led me out of the pit of misery and the quagmire. And he stationed my feet upon a rock, and he directed my steps.
Psalm 40:3	And he sent a new canticle into my mouth, a song to our God. Many will see, and they will fear; and they will hope in the Lord.
Psalm 40:4	Blessed is the man whose hope is in the name of the Lord, and who has no respect for vanities and absurd falsehoods.
Psalm 40:5	You have accomplished your many wonders, O Lord my God, and there is no one similar to you in your thoughts. I have announced and I have spoken: they are multiplied beyond number.
Psalm 40:6	Sacrifice and oblation, you did not want. But you have perfected ears for me. Holocaust and sin offering, you did not require.
Psalm 40:7	Then I said, “Behold, I draw near.” At the head of the book, it has been written of me:
Psalm 40:8	that I should do your will. My God, I have willed it. And your law is in the midst of my heart.
Psalm 40:9	I have announced your justice in a great Church: behold, I will not restrain my lips. O Lord, you have known it.
Psalm 40:10	I have not concealed your justice within my heart. I have spoken your truth and your salvation. I have not concealed your mercy and your truth from a great assembly.
Psalm 40:11	O Lord, do not take your tender mercies far from me. Your mercy and your truth ever sustain me.
Psalm 40:12	For evils without number have surrounded me. My iniquities have taken hold of me, and I was not able to see. They have been multiplied beyond the hairs of my head. And my heart has forsaken me.
Psalm 40:13	Be pleased, O Lord, to rescue me. Look down, O Lord, to help me.
Psalm 40:14	Let them together be confounded and awed, who seek after my soul to steal it away. Let them be turned back and be in awe, who wish evils upon me.
Psalm 40:15	Let them bear their confusion all at once, who say to me, “Well, well.”
Psalm 40:16	Let all who seek you exult and rejoice over you. And let those who love your salvation always say, “May the Lord be magnified.”
Psalm 40:17	But I am a beggar and poor. The Lord has been concerned about me. You are my helper and my protector. My God, do not delay.
Psalm 41:1	Unto the end. A Psalm of David himself. Blessed is he who shows understanding toward the needy and the poor. The Lord will deliver him in the evil day.
Psalm 41:2	May the Lord preserve him and give him life, and make him blessed upon the earth. And may he not hand him over to the will of his adversaries.
Psalm 41:3	May the Lord bring him help on his bed of sorrow. In his infirmity, you have changed his entire covering.
Psalm 41:4	I said, “O Lord, be merciful to me. Heal my soul, because I have sinned against you.”
Psalm 41:5	My enemies have spoken evils against me. When will he die and his name perish?
Psalm 41:6	And when he came in to see me, he was speaking emptiness. His heart gathered iniquity to itself. He went outside, and he was speaking in the same way.
Psalm 41:7	All my enemies were whispering against me. They were thinking up evils against me.
Psalm 41:8	They established an unjust word against me. Will he that sleeps no longer rise again?
Psalm 41:9	For even the man of my peace, in whom I hoped, who ate my bread, has greatly supplanted me.
Psalm 41:10	But you, O Lord, have mercy on me, and raise me up again. And I will requite them.
Psalm 41:11	By this, I knew that you preferred me: because my adversary will not rejoice over me.
Psalm 41:12	But you have sustained me, because of my innocence, and you have confirmed me in your sight in eternity.
Psalm 41:13	Blessed is the Lord God of Israel, for all generations and even forever. Amen. Amen.
Psalm 42:1	Unto the end. The understanding of the sons of Korah. As the deer longs for fountains of water, so my soul longs for you, O God.
Psalm 42:2	My soul has thirsted for the strong living God. When will I draw close and appear before the face of God?
Psalm 42:3	My tears have been my bread, day and night. Meanwhile, it is said to me daily: “Where is your God?”
Psalm 42:4	These things I have remembered; and my soul within me, I have poured out. For I will cross into the place of the wonderful tabernacle, all the way to the house of God, with a voice of exultation and confession, the sound of feasting.
Psalm 42:5	Why are you sad, my soul? And why do you disquiet me? Hope in God, for I will still confess to him: the salvation of my countenance,
Psalm 42:6	and my God. My soul has been troubled within myself. Because of this, I will remember you from the land of the Jordan and from Hermon, from the little mountain.
Psalm 42:7	Abyss calls upon abyss, with the voice of your floodgate. All your heights and your waves have passed over me.
Psalm 42:8	In the daylight, the Lord has ordered his mercy; and in the night, a canticle to him. With me is a prayer to the God of my life.
Psalm 42:9	I will say to God, “You are my supporter. Why have you forgotten me? And why do I walk in mourning, while my adversary afflicts me?”
Psalm 42:10	While my bones are being broken, my enemies, who trouble me, have reproached me. Meanwhile, they say to me every single day, “Where is your God?”
Psalm 42:11	My soul, why are you saddened? And why do you disquiet me? Hope in God, for I will still confess to him: the salvation of my countenance and my God.
Psalm 43:1	A Psalm of David. Judge me, O God, and discern my cause from that of a nation not holy; rescue me from a man unjust and deceitful.
Psalm 43:2	For you are God, my strength. Why have you rejected me? And why do I walk in sadness, while the adversary afflicts me?
Psalm 43:3	Send forth your light and your truth. They have guided me and led me, to your holy mountain and into your tabernacles.
Psalm 43:4	And I will enter, up to the altar of God, to God who enlivens my youthfulness. To you, O God, my God, I will confess upon a stringed instrument.
Psalm 43:5	Why are you sad, my soul? And why do you disquiet me? Hope in God, for I will still give praise to him: the salvation of my countenance and my God.
Psalm 44:1	Unto the end. To the sons of Korah, toward understanding.
Psalm 44:2	We have heard, O God, with our own ears. Our fathers have announced to us the work that you wrought in their days and in the days of antiquity.
Psalm 44:3	Your hand dispersed the Gentiles, and you transplanted them. You afflicted a people, and you expelled them.
Psalm 44:4	For they did not take possession of the land by their sword, and their own arm did not save them. But your right hand and your arm, and the light of your countenance did so, because you were pleased with them.
Psalm 44:5	You yourself are my king and my God, who commands the salvation of Jacob.
Psalm 44:6	With you, we will brandish a horn before our enemies; and in your name, we will spurn those rising up against us.
Psalm 44:7	For I will not hope in my bow, and my sword will not save me.
Psalm 44:8	For you have saved us from those who afflict us, and you have bewildered those who hate us.
Psalm 44:9	In God, we will give praise all day long; and in your name, we will confess forever.
Psalm 44:10	But now, you have rejected and bewildered us, and you will not go forth with our armies, O God.
Psalm 44:11	You have turned our back to our enemies, and those who hated us have plundered for themselves.
Psalm 44:12	You have given us over like sheep for food. You have scattered us among the Gentiles.
Psalm 44:13	You have sold your people without a price, and no great number was exchanged for them.
Psalm 44:14	You have set us as a disgrace to our neighbors, a scoff and a derision to those who are around us.
Psalm 44:15	You have set us as a parable among the Gentiles, a shaking of the head among the peoples.
Psalm 44:16	All day long my shame is before me, and the confusion of my face has covered me,
Psalm 44:17	before the voice of the reproacher and the commentator, before the face of the adversary and the pursuer.
Psalm 44:18	All these things have come upon us, yet we have not forgotten you, and we have not acted unjustly in your covenant.
Psalm 44:19	And our heart has not turned back. And you have not diverted our steps from your way.
Psalm 44:20	For you humbled us in a place of affliction, and the shadow of death has covered us.
Psalm 44:21	If we have forgotten the name of our God, and if we have extended our hands to a foreign god,
Psalm 44:22	will not God find this out? For he knows the secrets of the heart. For, because of you, we are being killed all day long. We are considered as sheep for the slaughter.
Psalm 44:23	Rise up. Why do you fall asleep, O Lord? Rise up, and do not reject us in the end.
Psalm 44:24	Why do you turn your face away, and why do you forget our needfulness and our tribulation?
Psalm 44:25	For our soul has been humbled into the dust. Our belly has been bound to the earth.
Psalm 44:26	Rise up, O Lord. Help us and redeem us, because of your name.
Psalm 45:1	Unto the end. For those who will be changed. To the sons of Korah, toward understanding. A Canticle for the Beloved. My heart has uttered a good word. I speak of my works to the king. My tongue is like the pen of a scribe who writes quickly.
Psalm 45:2	You are a brilliant form before the sons of men. Grace has been poured freely into your lips. Because of this, God has blessed you in eternity.
Psalm 45:3	Fasten your sword to your thigh, O most powerful one.
Psalm 45:4	With your splendor and your excellence extended, proceed prosperously, and reign for the sake of truth and meekness and justice, and so will your right hand lead you wondrously.
Psalm 45:5	Your arrows are sharp; the people will fall under you, with the hearts of the enemies of the king.
Psalm 45:6	Your throne, O God, is forever and ever. The scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of true aim.
Psalm 45:7	You have loved justice and hated iniquity. Because of this, God, your God, has anointed you, before your co-heirs, with the oil of gladness.
Psalm 45:8	Myrrh and balsam and cinnamon perfume your garments, from the houses of ivory. From these, they have delighted you:
Psalm 45:9	the daughters of kings in your honor. The queen assisted at your right hand, in clothing of gold, encircled with diversity.
Psalm 45:10	Listen, daughter, and see, and incline your ear. And forget your people and your father’s house.
Psalm 45:11	And the king will desire your beauty. For he is the Lord your God, and they will adore him.
Psalm 45:12	And the daughters of Tyre will entreat your countenance with gifts: all the rich men of the people.
Psalm 45:13	All the glory of the daughter of its king is inside, in golden fringes,
Psalm 45:14	clothed all around with diversities. After her, virgins will be led to the king. Her neighbors will be brought to you.
Psalm 45:15	They will be brought with gladness and exultation. They will be led into the temple of the king.
Psalm 45:16	For your fathers, sons have been born to you. You will establish them as leaders over all the earth.
Psalm 45:17	They will remember your name always, for generation after generation. Because of this, people will confess to you in eternity, even forever and ever.
Psalm 46:1	Unto the end. To the sons of Korah, for confidants. A Psalm. Our God is our refuge and strength, a helper in the tribulations that have greatly overwhelmed us.
Psalm 46:2	Because of this, we will not be afraid when the earth will be turbulent and the mountains will be transferred into the heart of the sea.
Psalm 46:3	They thundered, and the waters were stirred up among them; the mountains have been disturbed by his strength.
Psalm 46:4	The frenzy of the river rejoices the city of God. The Most High has sanctified his tabernacle.
Psalm 46:5	God is in its midst; it will not be shaken. God will assist it in the early morning.
Psalm 46:6	The peoples have been disturbed, and the kingdoms have been bowed down. He uttered his voice: the earth has been moved.
Psalm 46:7	The Lord of hosts is with us. The God of Jacob is our supporter.
Psalm 46:8	Draw near and behold the works of the Lord: what portents he has set upon the earth,
Psalm 46:9	carrying away wars even to the end of the earth. He will crush the bow and break the weapons, and he will burn the shield with fire.
Psalm 46:10	Be empty, and see that I am God. I will be exalted among the peoples, and I will be exalted upon the earth.
Psalm 46:11	The Lord of hosts is with us. The God of Jacob is our supporter.

Psalm 47:2	For the Lord is exalted and terrible: a great King over all the earth.
Psalm 47:3	He has subjected the peoples to us and subdued the nations under our feet.
Psalm 47:4	He has chosen us for his inheritance: the splendor of Jacob, whom he has loved.
Psalm 47:5	God ascends with jubilation, and the Lord with the voice of the trumpet.
Psalm 47:6	Sing psalms to our God, sing psalms. Sing psalms to our King, sing psalms.
Psalm 47:7	For God is the King of all the earth. Sing psalms wisely.
Psalm 47:8	God will reign over the peoples. God sits upon his holy throne.
Psalm 47:9	The leaders of the peoples have been gathered together by the God of Abraham. For the strong gods of the earth have been exceedingly exalted.
Psalm 48:1	A Canticle Psalm. To the sons of Korah, on the second Sabbath. The Lord is great and exceedingly praiseworthy, in the city of our God, on his holy mountain.
Psalm 48:2	Mount Zion is being founded with the exultation of the whole earth, on the north side, the city of the great king.
Psalm 48:3	In her houses, God will be known, since he will support her.
Psalm 48:4	For behold, the kings of the earth have been gathered together; they have convened as one.
Psalm 48:5	Such did they see, and they were astonished: they were disturbed, they were moved.
Psalm 48:6	Trembling took hold of them. In that place, their pains were that of a woman in labor.
Psalm 48:7	With a vehement spirit, you will crush the ships of Tarshish.
Psalm 48:8	As we have heard, so we have seen, in the city of the Lord of hosts, in the city of our God. God has founded it in eternity.
Psalm 48:9	We have received your mercy, O God, in the midst of your temple.
Psalm 48:10	According to your name, O God, so does your praise reach to the ends of the earth. Your right hand is full of justice.

Psalm 48:12	Encircle Zion and embrace her. Discourse in her towers.
Psalm 48:13	Set your hearts on her virtue. And distribute her houses, so that you may discourse of it in another generation.
Psalm 48:14	For this is God, our God, in eternity and forever and ever. He will rule us forever.
Psalm 49:1	Unto the end. A Psalm to the sons of Korah. Hear these things, all nations. Pay attention, all inhabitants of the world:
Psalm 49:2	whoever is earth-born, you sons of men, together as one, the rich and the poor.
Psalm 49:3	My mouth will speak wisdom, and the meditation of my heart will speak prudence.
Psalm 49:4	I will incline my ear to a parable. I will open my case with the psaltery.
Psalm 49:5	Why should I fear in the evil day? The iniquity at my heel will surround me.
Psalm 49:6	Those who trust in their own strength and who glory in the multitude of their riches,
Psalm 49:7	no brother redeems, nor will man buy back. He will not give to God his appeasement,
Psalm 49:8	nor the price for the redemption of his soul. And he will labor continuously,
Psalm 49:9	and he will still live, until the end.
Psalm 49:10	He will not see death, when he sees the wise dying: the foolish and the senseless will perish together. And they will leave their riches to strangers.
Psalm 49:11	And their sepulchers will be their houses forever, their tabernacles from generation to generation. They have called their names in their own lands.
Psalm 49:12	And man, when he was held in honor, did not understand. He has been compared to the senseless beasts, and he has become like them.
Psalm 49:13	This way of theirs is a scandal to them. And afterwards, they will delight in their mouth.
Psalm 49:14	They have been placed in Hell like sheep. Death will feed on them. And the just will have dominion over them in the morning. And their help will grow old in Hell for their glory.
Psalm 49:15	Even so, truly God will redeem my soul from the hand of Hell, when he will receive me.
Psalm 49:16	Do not be afraid, when a man will have been made rich, and when the glory of his house will have been multiplied.
Psalm 49:17	For when he dies, he will take nothing away, and his glory will not descend with him.
Psalm 49:18	For his soul will be blessed in his lifetime, and he will admit to you when you do good to him.
Psalm 49:19	He will even enter with the progeny of his fathers, but, even in eternity, he will not see the light.
Psalm 49:20	Man, when he was in honor, did not understand. He has been compared to the senseless beasts, and he has become like them.
Psalm 50:1	A Psalm of Asaph. The God of gods, the Lord has spoken, and he has called the earth, from the rising of the sun even to its setting,
Psalm 50:2	from Zion, the brilliance of his beauty.
Psalm 50:3	God will arrive manifestly. Our God also will not keep silence. A fire will flare up in his sight, and a mighty tempest will surround him.
Psalm 50:4	He will call to heaven from above, and to the earth, to discern his people.
Psalm 50:5	Gather his holy ones to him, you who order his covenant above sacrifices.
Psalm 50:6	And the heavens will announce his justice. For God is the judge.
Psalm 50:7	Listen, my people, and I will speak. Listen, Israel, and I will testify for you. I am God, your God.
Psalm 50:8	I will not reprove you for your sacrifices. Moreover, your holocausts are ever in my sight.
Psalm 50:9	I will not accept calves from your house, nor he-goats from your flocks.
Psalm 50:10	For all the wild beasts of the forest are mine: the cattle on the hills and the oxen.
Psalm 50:11	I know all the flying things of the air, and the beauty of the field is with me.
Psalm 50:12	If I should be hungry, I would not tell you: for the whole world is mine, and all its plentitude.
Psalm 50:13	Shall I gnaw on the flesh of bulls? Or would I drink the blood of goats?
Psalm 50:14	Offer to God the sacrifice of praise, and pay your vows to the Most High.
Psalm 50:15	And call upon me in the day of tribulation. I will rescue you, and you will honor me.
Psalm 50:16	But to the sinner, God has said: Why do you discourse on my justices, and take up my covenant through your mouth?
Psalm 50:17	Truly, you have hated discipline, and you have cast my sermons behind you.
Psalm 50:18	If you saw a thief, you ran with him, and you have placed your portion with adulterers.
Psalm 50:19	Your mouth has abounded with malice, and your tongue has concocted deceits.
Psalm 50:20	Sitting, you spoke against your brother, and you set up a scandal against your mother’s son.
Psalm 50:21	These things you have done, and I was silent. You thought, unjustly, that I ought to be like you. But I will reprove you, and I will set myself against your face.
Psalm 50:22	Understand these things, you who forget God; lest at any time, he might quickly take you away, and there would be no one to rescue you.
Psalm 50:23	The sacrifice of praise will honor me. And in that place is the journey by which I will reveal to him the salvation of God.

Psalm 51:3	For I know my iniquity, and my sin is ever before me.

Psalm 58:1	Unto the end. May you not destroy. Of David, with the inscription of a title. If, truly and certainly, you speak justice, then judge what is right, you sons of men.
Psalm 58:2	For, even in your heart, you work iniquity. Your hands construct injustice on the earth.
Psalm 58:3	Sinners have become foreigners from the womb; they have gone astray from conception. They have been speaking falsehoods.
Psalm 58:4	Their fury is similar to that of a serpent; it is like a deaf asp, who even blocks her ears,
Psalm 58:5	who will not listen to the voice of charmers, nor even to the enchanter who chants wisely.
Psalm 58:6	God will crush their teeth within their own mouth. The Lord will break the molars of the lions.

Psalm 73:11	And they said, “How would God know?” and, “Isn’t there knowledge in high places?”
Psalm 73:12	Behold, these are sinners, and, abounding in this age, they have obtained riches.
Psalm 73:13	And I said: So then, it is without purpose that I have justified my heart and washed my hands among the innocent.
Psalm 73:14	And I have been scourged all day long, and I have received my chastisement in the mornings.
Psalm 73:15	If I were to say that I would explain this: Behold, I would condemn this nation of your sons.
Psalm 73:16	I considered, so that I might know this. It is a hardship before me,
Psalm 73:17	until I may enter into the Sanctuary of God, and understand it to its last part.
Psalm 73:18	So, because of deceitfulness, truly, you have placed it before them. While they were being lifted up, you were casting them down.
Psalm 73:19	How have they been brought to desolation? They have suddenly failed. They have perished because of their iniquity.
Psalm 73:20	As a dream is to those who awaken, O Lord, so will you reduce their image to nothing in your city.
Psalm 73:21	For my heart has been inflamed, and my temperament has been changed.
Psalm 73:22	And so, I have been reduced to nothing, and I did not know it.
Psalm 73:23	I have become like a beast of burden to you, and I am always with you.
Psalm 73:24	You have held my right hand. And in your will, you have conducted me, and with your glory, you have taken me up.
Psalm 73:25	For what is there for me in heaven? And what do I wish for on earth before you?
Psalm 73:26	My body has failed, and my heart: O God of my heart, and God my portion, into eternity.
Psalm 73:27	For behold, those who put themselves far from you will perish. You have perished all those who fornicate away from you.
Psalm 73:28	But it is good for me to adhere to God, to put my hope in the Lord God, so that I may announce all your prophecies, at the gates of the daughter of Zion.
Psalm 74:1	The understanding of Asaph. O God, why have you rejected us to the end. Why has your fury become enraged over the sheep of your pasture?

Psalm 74:4	And those who hate you have been glorified, in the midst of your solemnity. They have set up their own signs as a proof,
Psalm 74:5	as if it had been issued from on high; yet they did not understand. As in a forest of chopped wood,

Psalm 74:23	Do not forget the voices of your adversaries. The arrogance of those who hate you rises up continually.

Psalm 77:1	Unto the end. For Jeduthun. A Psalm of Asaph. I cried out to the Lord with my voice, to God with my voice, and he attended to me.
Psalm 77:2	In the days of my tribulation, I sought God, with my hands opposite him in the night, and I was not deceived. My soul refused to be consoled.
Psalm 77:3	I was mindful of God, and I was delighted, and I was distressed, and my spirit fell away.
Psalm 77:4	My eyes anticipated the vigils. I was disturbed, and I did not speak.
Psalm 77:5	I considered the days of antiquity, and I held the years of eternity in my mind.
Psalm 77:6	And I meditated in the night with my heart, and I was distressed, and I examined my spirit.
Psalm 77:7	So then, will God reject for eternity? Will he not continue to allow himself to show favor?
Psalm 77:8	Or, will he cut off his mercy in the end, from generation to generation?
Psalm 77:9	And would God ever forget to be merciful? Or, would he, in his wrath, restrict his mercies?
Psalm 77:10	And I said, “Now I have begun. This change is from the right hand of the Most High.”
Psalm 77:11	I was mindful of the works of the Lord. For I will be mindful from the beginning of your wonders,
Psalm 77:12	and I will meditate on all your works. And I will take part in your intentions.
Psalm 77:13	Your way, O God, is in what is holy. Which God is great like our God?
Psalm 77:14	You are the God who performs miracles. You have made your virtue known among the peoples.
Psalm 77:15	With your arm, you have redeemed your people, the sons of Jacob and of Joseph.
Psalm 77:16	The waters saw you, O God, the waters saw you, and they were afraid, and the depths were stirred up.
Psalm 77:17	Great was the sound of the waters. The clouds uttered a voice. For your arrows also pass by.
Psalm 77:18	The voice of your thunder is like a wheel. Your flashes have illuminated the whole world. The earth has quaked and trembled.
Psalm 77:19	Your way is through the sea, and your paths are through many waters. And your traces will not be known.
Psalm 77:20	You have conducted your people like sheep, by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
Psalm 78:1	The understanding of Asaph. O my people, attend to my law. Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
Psalm 78:2	I will open my mouth in parables. I will speak about concepts that are from the beginning.
Psalm 78:3	We have heard and known such great things, as our fathers have described to us.
Psalm 78:4	These things have not been hidden from their sons in any generation: declaring the praises of the Lord, and his virtues, and the wonders that he has done.
Psalm 78:5	And he has received testimony with Jacob, and he has set a law within Israel. Such great things, he has commanded our fathers, so as to make these things known to their sons,
Psalm 78:6	so that another generation might know them, and so that the sons, who will be born and who will grow up, shall describe them to their sons.
Psalm 78:7	So then, may they put their hope in God, and may they not forget the works of God, and may they seek his commandments.
Psalm 78:8	May they not become like their fathers, a perverse and exasperating generation: a generation that does not straighten their heart and whose spirit is not trustworthy with God.
Psalm 78:9	The sons of Ephraim, who bend and shoot the bow, have been turned back in the day of battle.
Psalm 78:10	They have not kept the covenant of God. And they were not willing to walk in his law.
Psalm 78:11	And they have been forgetful of his benefits, and of his miracle, which he revealed to them.
Psalm 78:12	He performed miracles in the sight of their fathers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Tanis.
Psalm 78:13	He broke the sea and he led them through. And he stationed the waters, as if in a vessel.
Psalm 78:14	And he led them with a cloud by day, and with illumination by fire throughout the night.
Psalm 78:15	He broke through the rock in the wasteland, and he gave them to drink, as if from the great abyss.
Psalm 78:16	He brought forth water from the rock, and he conducted the waters, as if they were rivers.
Psalm 78:17	And yet, they continued to sin against him. In a waterless place, they provoked the Most High with resentment.
Psalm 78:18	And they tempted God in their hearts, by asking for food according to their desires.
Psalm 78:19	And they spoke badly about God. They said, “Would God be able to prepare a table in the desert?
Psalm 78:20	He struck the rock, and so waters flowed and the torrents flooded, but would even he be able to provide bread, or provide a table, for his people?”
Psalm 78:21	Therefore, the Lord heard, and he was dismayed, and a fire was kindled within Jacob, and an anger ascended into Israel.
Psalm 78:22	For they neither put their trust in God, nor did they hope in his salvation.
Psalm 78:23	And he commanded the clouds from above, and he opened the doors of heaven.
Psalm 78:24	And he rained down manna upon them to eat, and he gave them the bread of heaven.
Psalm 78:25	Man ate the bread of Angels. He sent them provisions in abundance.
Psalm 78:26	He transferred the south wind from heaven, and, in his virtue, he brought in the Southwest wind.
Psalm 78:27	And he rained down flesh upon them, as if it were dust, and feathered birds, as if they were the sand of the sea.
Psalm 78:28	And they fell down in the midst of their camp, encircling their tabernacles.
Psalm 78:29	And they ate until they were greatly satisfied, and he brought to them according to their desires.
Psalm 78:30	They were not cheated out of what they wanted. Their food was still in their mouth,
Psalm 78:31	and then the wrath of God came upon them. And he slew the fat ones among them, and he impeded the elect of Israel.
Psalm 78:32	In all these things, they continued to sin, and they were not trustworthy with his miracles.
Psalm 78:33	And their days faded away into vanity, and their years with haste.
Psalm 78:34	When he slew them, then they sought him. And they returned, and they drew near to him in the early morning.
Psalm 78:35	And they were mindful that God is their helper and that the Most High God is their redeemer.
Psalm 78:36	And they chose him with their mouth, and then they lied to him with their tongue.
Psalm 78:37	For their heart was not upright with him, nor have they been living faithfully in his covenant.
Psalm 78:38	Yet he is merciful, and he will pardon their sins. And he will not destroy them. And he has abundantly turned aside his own wrath. And he did not enflame his wrath entirely.
Psalm 78:39	And he remembered that they are flesh: with a spirit that goes forth and does not return.
Psalm 78:40	How often did they provoke him in the desert and stir him to wrath in a waterless place?
Psalm 78:41	And they turned back and tempted God, and they exasperated the Holy One of Israel.
Psalm 78:42	They did not remember his hand, in the day that he redeemed them from the hand of the one troubling them.
Psalm 78:43	Thus, he positioned his signs in Egypt and his wonders in the field of Tanis.
Psalm 78:44	And he turned their rivers into blood, along with their rain showers, so that they could not drink.
Psalm 78:45	He sent among them the common fly, and it devoured them, and the frog, and it scattered them.
Psalm 78:46	And he gave up their fruits to mold and their labors to the locust.
Psalm 78:47	And he slew their vineyards with hail and their mulberry trees with severe frost.
Psalm 78:48	And he delivered their cattle to the hail and their possessions to fire.
Psalm 78:49	And he sent the wrath of his indignation among them: indignation and wrath and tribulation, sent forth by evil angels.
Psalm 78:50	He made way for the path of his anger. He did not spare their souls from death. And he enclosed their beasts of burden in death.
Psalm 78:51	And he struck all the first-born in the land of Egypt: the first-fruits of all their labor in the tabernacles of Ham.
Psalm 78:52	And he took away his own people like sheep, and he led them through the wilderness like a flock.
Psalm 78:53	And he led them out in hope, and they did not fear. And the sea covered their enemies.
Psalm 78:54	And he led them to the mountain of his sanctification: the mountain that his right hand had acquired. And he cast out the Gentiles before their face. And he divided their land by lot to them, with a line of distribution.
Psalm 78:55	And he caused the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tabernacles.
Psalm 78:56	Yet they tempted and aggravated God Most High, and they did not keep his testaments.
Psalm 78:57	And they turned themselves aside, and they did not serve the covenant. In the same manner as their fathers, they were turned backwards, like a crooked bow.
Psalm 78:58	They impelled him to anger on their hills, and they provoked him to rivalry with their graven images.
Psalm 78:59	God listened, and he spurned them, and he reduced Israel greatly, almost to nothing.
Psalm 78:60	And he rejected the tabernacle of Shiloh, his tabernacle where he had dwelt among men.
Psalm 78:61	And he delivered their virtue into captivity, and their beauty into the hands of the enemy.
Psalm 78:62	And he enclosed his people with the sword, and he spurned his inheritance.
Psalm 78:63	Fire consumed their young men, and their virgins were not lamented.
Psalm 78:64	Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows did not weep.
Psalm 78:65	And the Lord was awaked, as if out of sleep, and like a powerful man impaired by wine.
Psalm 78:66	And he struck his enemies on the back. He gave them over to everlasting disgrace.
Psalm 78:67	And he rejected the tabernacle of Joseph, and he did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.
Psalm 78:68	But he chose the tribe of Judah: mount Zion, which he loved.
Psalm 78:69	And he built up his sanctuary, like a single-horned beast, in the land that he founded for all ages.
Psalm 78:70	And he chose his servant David, and he took him from the flocks of the sheep: he received him from following the ewes with their young,
Psalm 78:71	in order to pasture Jacob his servant and Israel his inheritance.
Psalm 78:72	And he fed them with the innocence of his heart. And he led them with the understanding of his hands.

Psalm 86:5	For you are sweet and mild, Lord, and plentiful in mercy to all who call upon you.

Psalm 86:7	In the day of my tribulation, I cried out to you, because you heeded me.
Psalm 86:8	There is no one like you among the gods, O Lord, and there is no one like you in your works.
Psalm 86:9	All the nations, which you have made, will draw near and adore in your presence, O Lord. And they will glorify your name.
Psalm 86:10	For you are great, and you perform wonders. You alone are God.
Psalm 86:11	Lead me, O Lord, in your way, and I will walk in your truth. May my heart rejoice, so that it will fear your name.
Psalm 86:12	I will confess to you, O Lord my God, with my whole heart. And I will glorify your name in eternity.
Psalm 86:13	For your mercy toward me is great, and you have rescued my soul from the lower part of Hell.
Psalm 86:14	O God, the iniquitous have risen up against me, and the synagogue of the powerful have sought my soul, and they have not placed you in their sight.
Psalm 86:15	And you, Lord God, are compassionate and merciful, being patient and full of mercy and truthful.
Psalm 86:16	Look down upon me and have mercy on me. Grant your authority to your servant, and bring salvation to the son of your handmaid.
Psalm 86:17	Make me a sign of what is good, so that those who hate me, may look and be confounded. For you, O Lord, have helped me and consoled me.
Psalm 87:1	A Canticle Psalm to the sons of Korah. Its foundations are in the holy mountains:
Psalm 87:2	the Lord loves the gates of Zion above all the tabernacles of Jacob.
Psalm 87:3	Glorious things are being said of you, O City of God.
Psalm 87:4	I will be mindful of Rahab and of Babylon knowing me. Behold, the foreigners, and Tyre, and the people of the Ethiopians: these have been there.
Psalm 87:5	Will not Zion say that this man and that man were born in her? And the Most High himself has founded her.
Psalm 87:6	The Lord will explain, in the writings of peoples and of leaders, about those who have been in her.
Psalm 87:7	For so the dwelling place within you is with all rejoicing.
Psalm 88:1	A Canticle Psalm to the sons of Korah. Unto the end. For Mahalath, to answer the understanding of Heman the Ezrahite. O Lord, God of my salvation: I have cried out, day and night, in your presence.
Psalm 88:2	Let my prayer enter in your sight. Incline your ear to my petition.
Psalm 88:3	For my soul has been filled with evils, and my life has drawn near to Hell.
Psalm 88:4	I am considered to be among those who will descend into the pit. I have become like a man without assistance,
Psalm 88:5	idle among the dead. I am like the wounded sleeping in sepulchers, whom you no longer remember, and who have been repelled by your hand.
Psalm 88:6	They have lain me in the lower pit: in dark places and in the shadow of death.
Psalm 88:7	Your fury has been confirmed over me. And you have brought all your waves upon me.
Psalm 88:8	You have sent my acquaintances far from me. They have set me as an abomination to themselves. I was handed over, yet I did not depart.
Psalm 88:9	My eyes languished before destitution. All day long, I cried out to you, O Lord. I stretched out my hands to you.
Psalm 88:10	Will you perform wonders for the dead? Or will physicians raise to life, and so confess to you?
Psalm 88:11	Could anyone declare your mercy in the sepulcher, or your truth from within perdition?
Psalm 88:12	Will your wonders be known in the darkness, or your justice in the land of oblivion?
Psalm 88:13	And I have cried out to you, O Lord, and in early morning, my prayer will come before you.
Psalm 88:14	Lord, why do you reject my prayer? Why do you turn your face away from me?
Psalm 88:15	I am poor, and I have been amid hardships from my youth. And, though I have been exalted, I am humbled and disturbed.
Psalm 88:16	Your wrath has crossed into me, and your terrors have disturbed me.
Psalm 88:17	They have surrounded me like water, all day long. They have surrounded me, all at once.
Psalm 88:18	Friend and neighbor, and my acquaintances, you have sent far away from me, away from misery.
Psalm 89:1	The understanding of Ethan the Ezrahite. I will sing the mercies of the Lord in eternity. I will announce your truth with my mouth, from generation to generation.
Psalm 89:2	For you have said: Mercy will be built in the heavens, unto eternity. Your truth will be prepared there.
Psalm 89:3	I have set up a covenant with my elect. I have sworn to David my servant:
Psalm 89:4	I will prepare your offspring, even in eternity. And I will build up your throne, from generation to generation.
Psalm 89:5	The heavens will confess your miracles, Lord, and also your truth, in the Church of the saints.
Psalm 89:6	For who among the clouds is equal to the Lord? Who among the sons of God is like God?
Psalm 89:7	God is glorified by the counsel of the saints. He is great and terrible above all those who are around him.
Psalm 89:8	O Lord, God of hosts, who is like you? You are powerful, Lord, and your truth is all around you.
Psalm 89:9	You rule over the power of the sea, and you even mitigate the movement of its waves.
Psalm 89:10	You have humbled the arrogant one, like one who has been wounded. You have scattered your enemies with the arm of your strength.
Psalm 89:11	Yours are the heavens, and yours is the earth. You founded the whole world in all its fullness.
Psalm 89:12	You created the north and the sea. Tabor and Hermon will exult in your name.
Psalm 89:13	Your arm acts with power. Let your hand be strengthened, and let your right hand be exalted.
Psalm 89:14	Justice and judgment are the preparation of your throne. Mercy and truth will precede your face.
Psalm 89:15	Blessed is the people that knows jubilation. They will walk in the light of your countenance, O Lord,
Psalm 89:16	and they will exult in your name all day long, and they will be exalted in your justice.
Psalm 89:17	For you are the glory of their virtue, and in your goodness, our horn will be exalted.
Psalm 89:18	For our assumption is of the Lord, and it is of our king, the holy one of Israel.
Psalm 89:19	Then you spoke in a vision to your holy ones, and you said: I have stationed help with the powerful one, and I have exalted the elect one from my people.
Psalm 89:20	I have found my servant David. I have anointed him with my holy oil.
Psalm 89:21	For my hand will assist him, and my arm will fortify him.
Psalm 89:22	The enemy will have no advantage over him, nor will the son of iniquity be positioned to harm him.
Psalm 89:23	And I will cut down his enemies before his face. And those who hate him, I will turn to flight.
Psalm 89:24	And my truth and my mercy will be with him. And his horn will be exalted in my name.
Psalm 89:25	And I will place his hand on the sea and his right hand on the rivers.
Psalm 89:26	He will invoke me: “You are my father, my God, and the support of my salvation.”
Psalm 89:27	And I will make him the first-born, preeminent before the kings of the earth.
Psalm 89:28	I will preserve my mercy for him eternally, and my covenant for him faithfully.
Psalm 89:29	And I will set his offspring from generation to generation, and his throne like the days of heaven.
Psalm 89:30	But if his sons abandon my law, and if they do not walk in my judgments,
Psalm 89:31	if they profane my justices, and if they do not keep my commandments:
Psalm 89:32	I will visit their iniquities with a rod, and their sins with a beating.
Psalm 89:33	But I will not scatter my mercy from him, and I will not do harm to my truth.
Psalm 89:34	And I will not profane my covenant, and I will not make void that which proceeds from my lips.
Psalm 89:35	I have sworn by my holiness one time: I will not lie to David,
Psalm 89:36	his offspring will remain for eternity. And his throne will be like the sun in my sight,
Psalm 89:37	and, like the moon, it is perfected in eternity, and it is a faithful witness in heaven.
Psalm 89:38	Yet, truly, you have rejected and despised, you have pushed away, my Christ.
Psalm 89:39	You have overthrown the covenant of your servant. You have profaned his sanctuary on earth.
Psalm 89:40	You have destroyed all his fences. You have made his territory dreadful.
Psalm 89:41	All who pass by the way have plundered him. He has become a disgrace to his neighbors.
Psalm 89:42	You have exalted the right hand of those who oppress him. You have brought joy to all his enemies.
Psalm 89:43	You have diverted the help of his sword, and you have not assisted him in battle.
Psalm 89:44	You have torn him away from cleansing, and you have smashed his throne down to the ground.
Psalm 89:45	You have reduced the days of his time. You have flooded him with confusion.
Psalm 89:46	How long, O Lord? Will you turn away unto the end? Will your wrath flare up like a fire?
Psalm 89:47	Remember what my substance is. For could you really have appointed all the sons of men in vain?
Psalm 89:48	Who is the man that will live, and yet not see death? Who will rescue his own soul from the hand of the underworld?
Psalm 89:49	O Lord, where are your mercies of antiquity, just as you swore to David in your truth?
Psalm 89:50	Be mindful, O Lord, of the disgrace of your servants (which I have sustained in my sinews) among many nations.
Psalm 89:51	With these, your enemies have reproached you, O Lord; with these, they have reproached the commutation of your Christ.
Psalm 89:52	Blessed is the Lord for all eternity. Amen. Amen.
Psalm 90:1	A prayer of Moses, the man of God. O Lord, you have been our refuge from generation to generation.
Psalm 90:2	Before the mountains became, or the land was formed along with the world: from ages past, even to all ages, you are God.
Psalm 90:3	And, lest man be turned aside in humiliation, you have said: Be converted, O sons of men.
Psalm 90:4	For a thousand years before your eyes are like the days of yesterday, which have passed by, and they are like a watch of the night,
Psalm 90:5	which was held for nothing: so their years shall be.
Psalm 90:6	In the morning, he may pass away like grass; in the morning, he may flower and pass away. In the evening, he will fall, and harden, and become dry.
Psalm 90:7	For, at your wrath, we have withered away, and we have been disturbed by your fury.
Psalm 90:8	You have placed our iniquities in your sight, our age in the illumination of your countenance.
Psalm 90:9	For all our days have faded away, and at your wrath, we have fainted. Our years will be considered to be like a spider’s web.
Psalm 90:10	The days of our years in them are seventy years. But in the powerful, they are eighty years, and more of these are with hardship and sorrow. For mildness has overwhelmed us, and we shall be corrected.
Psalm 90:11	Who knows the power of your wrath? And, before fear, can your wrath
Psalm 90:12	be numbered? So make known your right hand, along with men learned in heart, in wisdom.
Psalm 90:13	Return, O Lord, how long? And may you be persuaded on behalf of your servants.
Psalm 90:14	We were filled in the morning with your mercy, and we exulted and delighted all our days.
Psalm 90:15	We have been rejoicing, because of the days in which you humbled us, because of the years in which we saw evils.
Psalm 90:16	Look down upon your servants and upon their works, and direct their sons.
Psalm 90:17	And may the splendor of the Lord our God be upon us. And so, direct the works of our hands over us; direct even the work of our hands.
Psalm 91:1	The Praise of a Canticle, of David. Whoever dwells with the assistance of the Most High will abide in the protection of the God of heaven.
Psalm 91:2	He will say to the Lord, “You are my supporter and my refuge.” My God, I will hope in him.
Psalm 91:3	For he has freed me from the snare of those who go hunting, and from the harsh word.
Psalm 91:4	He will overshadow you with his shoulders, and you will hope under his wings.
Psalm 91:5	His truth will surround you with a shield. You will not be afraid: before the terror of the night,
Psalm 91:6	before the arrow flying in the day, before the troubles that wander in the darkness, nor of invasion and the midday demon.
Psalm 91:7	A thousand will fall before your side and ten thousand before your right hand. Yet it will not draw near you.
Psalm 91:8	So then, truly, you will consider with your eyes, and you will see the retribution of sinners.
Psalm 91:9	For you, O Lord, are my hope. You have set the Most High as your refuge.
Psalm 91:10	Disaster will not draw near to you, and the scourge will not approach your tabernacle.
Psalm 91:11	For he has given his Angels charge over you, so as to preserve you in all your ways.
Psalm 91:12	With their hands, they will carry you, lest you hurt your foot against a stone.
Psalm 91:13	You will walk over the asp and the king serpent, and you will trample the lion and the dragon.
Psalm 91:14	Because he has hoped in me, I will free him. I will protect him because he has known my name.
Psalm 91:15	He will cry out to me, and I will heed him. I am with him in tribulation. I will rescue him, and I will glorify him.
Psalm 91:16	I will fill him with length of days. And I will reveal to him my salvation.
Psalm 92:1	A Canticle Psalm. On the day of the Sabbath. It is good to confess to the Lord and to sing psalms to your name, O Most High:
Psalm 92:2	to announce your mercy in the morning, and your truth throughout the night,
Psalm 92:3	upon the ten strings, upon the psaltery, with a canticle, upon stringed instruments.
Psalm 92:4	For you, O Lord, have delighted me with your doings, and I will exult in the works of your hands.
Psalm 92:5	How great are your works, O Lord! Your thoughts have been made exceedingly deep.
Psalm 92:6	A foolish man will not know these things, and a senseless one will not understand:
Psalm 92:7	when sinners will have risen up like grass, and when all those who work iniquity will have appeared, that they shall pass away, age after age.
Psalm 92:8	But you, O Lord, are the Most High for all eternity.
Psalm 92:9	For behold your enemies, O Lord, for behold your enemies will perish, and all those who work iniquity will be dispersed.
Psalm 92:10	And my horn will be exalted like that of the single-horned beast, and my old age will be exalted in fruitful mercy.
Psalm 92:11	And my eye has looked down upon my enemies, and my ear will hear of the malignant rising up against me.
Psalm 92:12	The just one will flourish like the palm tree. He will be multiplied like the cedar of Lebanon.
Psalm 92:13	Those planted in the house of the Lord will flourish in the courts of the house of our God.
Psalm 92:14	They will still be multiplied in a fruitful old age, and they will endure well,
Psalm 92:15	so that they may announce that the Lord our God is righteous and that there is no iniquity in him.
Psalm 93:1	The Praise of a Canticle, of David himself. In the time before the Sabbath, when the earth was founded. The Lord has reigned. He has been clothed with beauty. The Lord has been clothed with strength, and he has girded himself. Yet he has also confirmed the world, which will not be moved.
Psalm 93:2	My throne is prepared from of old. You are from everlasting.
Psalm 93:3	The floods have lifted up, O Lord, the floods have lifted up their voice. The floods have lifted up their waves,
Psalm 93:4	before the noise of many waters. Wondrous are the surges of the sea; wondrous is the Lord on high.
Psalm 93:5	Your testimonies have been made exceedingly trustworthy. Sanctity befits your house, O Lord, with length of days.
Psalm 94:1	A Psalm of David himself. The Fourth Sabbath. The Lord is the God of retribution. The God of retribution acts in order to deliver.
Psalm 94:2	Lift yourself up, for you judge the earth. Repay the arrogant with retribution.
Psalm 94:3	How long will sinners, O Lord, how long will sinners glory?
Psalm 94:4	How long will they utter and speak iniquity? How long will all who work injustice speak out?
Psalm 94:5	They have humiliated your people, O Lord, and they have harassed your inheritance.
Psalm 94:6	They have executed the widow and the new arrival, and they have slaughtered the orphan.
Psalm 94:7	And they have said, “The Lord will not see, nor will the God of Jacob understand.”
Psalm 94:8	Understand, you senseless ones among the people. And be wise at last, you foolish ones.
Psalm 94:9	He who formed the ear, will he not hear? And he who forged the eye, does he not look closely?
Psalm 94:10	He who chastises nations, he who teaches man knowledge, will he not rebuke?
Psalm 94:11	The Lord knows the thoughts of men: that these are in vain.
Psalm 94:12	Blessed is the man whom you will instruct, O Lord. And you will teach him from your law.
Psalm 94:13	So may you soothe him from the evil days, until a pit may be dug for sinners.
Psalm 94:14	For the Lord will not drive away his people, and he will not abandon his inheritance,
Psalm 94:15	even until the time when justice is being converted into judgment, and when those who are close to justice are all those who are upright of heart.
Psalm 94:16	Who will rise up with me against the malignant? Or who will stand with me against the workers of iniquity?
Psalm 94:17	Except that the Lord assisted me, my soul almost would have dwelt in Hell.
Psalm 94:18	If ever I said, “My foot is slipping,” then your mercy, O Lord, assisted me.
Psalm 94:19	According to the multitude of my sorrows in my heart, your consolations have given joy to my soul.
Psalm 94:20	Does the seat of iniquity adhere to you, you who contrive hardship within a commandment?
Psalm 94:21	They will hunt down the soul of the just, and they will condemn innocent blood.
Psalm 94:22	And the Lord has been made into a refuge for me, and my God into the assistance of my hope.
Psalm 94:23	And he will repay them their iniquity, and he will destroy them in their malice. The Lord our God will utterly destroy them.

Psalm 95:3	For the Lord is a great God and a great King over all gods.

Psalm 101:1	A Psalm of David himself. I will sing mercy and judgment to you, O Lord. I will sing psalms.
Psalm 101:2	And I will have understanding within the immaculate way, when you will draw near to me. I wandered about in the innocence of my heart, in the midst of my house.
Psalm 101:3	I will not display any unjust thing before my eyes. I have hated those carrying out betrayals.
Psalm 101:4	The perverse heart did not adhere to me. And the malignant, who turned away before me, I would not recognize.
Psalm 101:5	The one who secretly detracted his neighbor, this one I pursued. The one with an arrogant eye and an insatiable heart, with that one I would not eat.
Psalm 101:6	My eyes looked toward the faithful of the earth, to sit with me. The one walking in the immaculate way, this one ministered to me.
Psalm 101:7	He who has acted arrogantly will not dwell in the midst of my house. He who has spoken iniquity was not guided with the sight of my eyes.

Psalm 102:1	The prayer of the pauper, when he was anxious, and so he poured out his petition in the sight of the Lord. O Lord, hear my prayer, and let my outcry reach you.
Psalm 102:2	Do not turn your face away from me. In whatever day that I am in trouble, incline your ear to me. In whatever day that I will call upon you, heed me quickly.
Psalm 102:3	For my days have faded away like smoke, and my bones have dried out like firewood.
Psalm 102:4	I have been cut down like hay, and my heart has withered, for I had forgotten to eat my bread.
Psalm 102:5	Before the voice of my groaning, my bone has adhered to my flesh.
Psalm 102:6	I have become like a pelican in solitude. I have become like a night raven in a house.
Psalm 102:7	I have kept vigil, and I have become like a solitary sparrow on a roof.
Psalm 102:8	All day long my enemies reproached me, and those who praised me swore oaths against me.
Psalm 102:9	For I chewed on ashes like bread, and I mixed weeping into my drink.
Psalm 102:10	By the face of your anger and indignation, you lifted me up and threw me down.
Psalm 102:11	My days have declined like a shadow, and I have dried out like hay.
Psalm 102:12	But you, O Lord, endure for eternity, and your memorial is from generation to generation.
Psalm 102:13	You will rise up and take pity on Zion, for it is time for its mercy, for the time has come.
Psalm 102:14	For its stones have pleased your servants, and they will take pity on its land.
Psalm 102:15	And the Gentiles will fear your name, O Lord, and all the kings of the earth your glory.
Psalm 102:16	For the Lord has built up Zion, and he will be seen in his glory.
Psalm 102:17	He has noticed of the prayer of the humble, and he has not despised their petition.
Psalm 102:18	Let these things be written in another generation, and the people who will be created will praise the Lord.
Psalm 102:19	For he has gazed from his high sanctuary. From heaven, the Lord has beheld the earth.
Psalm 102:20	So may he hear the groans of those in shackles, in order that he may release the sons of the slain.
Psalm 102:21	So may they announce the name of the Lord in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem:
Psalm 102:22	while the people convene, along with kings, in order that they may serve the Lord.
Psalm 102:23	He responded to him in the way of his virtue: Declare to me the brevity of my days.
Psalm 102:24	Do not call me back in the middle of my days: your years are from generation to generation.
Psalm 102:25	In the beginning, O Lord, you founded the earth. And the heavens are the work of your hands.
Psalm 102:26	They will perish, but you remain. And all will grow old like a garment. And, like a blanket, you will change them, and they will be changed.
Psalm 102:27	Yet you are ever yourself, and your years will not decline.
Psalm 102:28	The sons of your servants will live, and their offspring will be guided aright in every age.

Psalm 103:2	Bless the Lord, O my soul, and do not forget all his recompenses.
Psalm 103:3	He forgives all your iniquities. He heals all your infirmities.
Psalm 103:4	He redeems your life from destruction. He crowns you with mercy and compassion.
Psalm 103:5	He satisfies your desire with good things. Your youth will be renewed like that of the eagle.
Psalm 103:6	The Lord accomplishes mercies, and his judgment is for all who patiently endure injuries.
Psalm 103:7	He has made his ways known to Moses, his will to the sons of Israel.
Psalm 103:8	The Lord is compassionate and merciful, patient and full of mercy.
Psalm 103:9	He will not be angry forever, and he will not threaten for eternity.
Psalm 103:10	He has not dealt with us according to our sins, and he has not repaid us according to our iniquities.
Psalm 103:11	For according to the height of the heavens above the earth, so has he reinforced his mercy toward those who fear him.
Psalm 103:12	As far as the east is from the west, so far has he removed our iniquities from us.
Psalm 103:13	As a father is compassionate to his sons, so has the Lord been compassionate to those who fear him.
Psalm 103:14	For he knows our form. He has called to mind that we are dust.
Psalm 103:15	Man: his days are like hay. Like the flower of the field, so will he flourish.
Psalm 103:16	For the spirit in him will pass away, and it will not remain, and he will know his place no longer.
Psalm 103:17	But the mercy of the Lord is from eternity, and even unto eternity, upon those who fear him. And his justice is with the sons of the sons,
Psalm 103:18	with those who serve his covenant and have been mindful of his commandments by doing them.
Psalm 103:19	The Lord has prepared his throne in heaven, and his kingdom will rule over all.
Psalm 103:20	Bless the Lord, all you his Angels: powerful in virtue, doing his word, in order to heed the voice of his discourse.
Psalm 103:21	Bless the Lord, all his hosts: his ministers who do his will.
Psalm 103:22	Bless the Lord, all his works: in every place of his dominion. Bless the Lord, O my soul.
Psalm 104:1	To David himself. Bless the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, you are exceedingly great. You have clothed yourself with confession and beauty;
Psalm 104:2	you are dressed with light like a garment, while you stretch out heaven like a tent.
Psalm 104:3	You cover its heights with water. You set the clouds as your stairs. You walk upon the wings of the winds.
Psalm 104:4	You make your Angels a breath of life, and your ministers a burning fire.
Psalm 104:5	You founded the earth upon its stable base. It will not be bent from age to age.
Psalm 104:6	The abyss, like a garment, is its clothing. The waters will remain standing above the mountains.
Psalm 104:7	At your rebuke, they will flee. At the voice of your thunder, they will dread.
Psalm 104:8	The mountains ascend, and the plains descend, to the place which you have founded for them.
Psalm 104:9	You have set a limit that they will not cross. And they will not return to cover the earth.
Psalm 104:10	You spring forth fountains in steep valleys. The waters will cross through the midst of the mountains.
Psalm 104:11	All the wild beasts of the field will drink. The wild donkeys will anticipate in their thirst.
Psalm 104:12	Above them, the flying things of the air will dwell. From the midst of the rocks, they will utter voices.
Psalm 104:13	You irrigate the mountains from your heights. The earth will be satiated from the fruit of your works,
Psalm 104:14	producing grass for cattle and herbs for the service of men. So may you draw bread from the earth,
Psalm 104:15	and wine, in order to cheer the heart of man. Then he may gladden his face with oil, and bread will confirm the heart of man.
Psalm 104:16	The trees of the field will be saturated, along with the cedars of Lebanon, which he planted.
Psalm 104:17	There, the sparrows will make their nests. The leader of them is the house of the heron.
Psalm 104:18	The heights of the hills are for the deer; the rock is a refuge for the hedgehog.
Psalm 104:19	He has made the moon for seasons; the sun knows its setting.
Psalm 104:20	You appointed darkness, and it has become night; all the beasts of the forest will cross through it.
Psalm 104:21	The young lions will roar, while searching for and seizing their meal from God.
Psalm 104:22	The sun arose, and they were gathered together; and in their dens, they will lie down together.
Psalm 104:23	Man will go forth to his work and to his activities, until the evening.
Psalm 104:24	How great are your works, O Lord! You have made all things in wisdom. The earth has been filled with your possessions.
Psalm 104:25	This sea is great and its hands are spacious. There are creeping things without number: the small animals with the great.
Psalm 104:26	There, the ships will pass by this sea-serpent that you have formed to mock them.
Psalm 104:27	All these expect you to give them food in due time.
Psalm 104:28	What you give to them, they will gather. When you open your hand, they will all be filled with goodness.
Psalm 104:29	But if you turn your face away, they will be disturbed. You will take away their breath, and they will fail, and they will return to their dust.
Psalm 104:30	You will send forth your Spirit, and they will be created. And you will renew the face of the earth.
Psalm 104:31	May the glory of the Lord be for all ages. The Lord will rejoice in his works.
Psalm 104:32	He considers the earth, and he makes it tremble. He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
Psalm 104:33	I will sing to the Lord with my life. I will sing psalms to my God, as long as I am.
Psalm 104:34	May my speech be pleasing to him. Truly, I will take delight in the Lord.
Psalm 104:35	Let sinners fade away from the earth, along with the unjust, so that they may not be. Bless the Lord, O my soul.
Psalm 105:1	Alleluia. Confess to the Lord, and invoke his name. Announce his works among the nations.
Psalm 105:2	Sing to him, and sing psalms to him. Describe all his wonders.
Psalm 105:3	Be praised in his holy name. Let the heart of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
Psalm 105:4	Seek the Lord, and be confirmed. Seek his face always.
Psalm 105:5	Remember his miracles, which he has done, his portents and the judgments of his mouth:
Psalm 105:6	you offspring of Abraham his servant, you sons of Jacob his elect.
Psalm 105:7	He is the Lord our God. His judgments are throughout the entire earth.
Psalm 105:8	He has remembered his covenant for all ages: the word that he entrusted to a thousand generations,
Psalm 105:9	which he assigned to Abraham, and his oath to Isaac.
Psalm 105:10	And he stationed the same for Jacob with a precept, and for Israel with an eternal testament,
Psalm 105:11	saying: To you, I will give the land of Canaan, the allotment of your inheritance.
Psalm 105:12	Though they may have been but a small number, very few and foreigners there,
Psalm 105:13	and though they passed from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people,
Psalm 105:14	he allowed no man to harm them, and he reproved kings on their behalf.
Psalm 105:15	Do not be willing to touch my Christ, and do not be willing to malign my prophets.
Psalm 105:16	And he called a famine upon the land, and he crushed every foundation of the bread.
Psalm 105:17	He sent a man before them: Joseph, who had been sold as a slave.
Psalm 105:18	They humbled his feet in shackles; the iron pierced his soul,
Psalm 105:19	until his word arrived. The eloquence of the Lord inflamed him.
Psalm 105:20	The king sent and released him; he was the ruler of the people, and he dismissed him.
Psalm 105:21	He established him as master of his house and ruler of all his possessions,
Psalm 105:22	so that he might instruct his princes as himself, and teach his elders prudence.
Psalm 105:23	And Israel entered into Egypt, and Jacob became a sojourner in the land of Ham.
Psalm 105:24	And he helped his people greatly, and he strengthened them over their enemies.
Psalm 105:25	He turned their heart to hate his people, and to deal deceitfully with his servants.
Psalm 105:26	He sent Moses, his servant, and Aaron, the one whom he chose.
Psalm 105:27	He placed with them signs of his word, and portents in the land of Ham.
Psalm 105:28	He sent darkness and made it conceal, and he did not afflict them with his speech.
Psalm 105:29	He turned their waters into blood, and he slaughtered their fish.
Psalm 105:30	Their land brought forth frogs, even in the inner chambers of their kings.
Psalm 105:31	He spoke, and there came forth common flies and gnats, in every region.
Psalm 105:32	He gave them a shower of hail and a burning fire, in the same land.
Psalm 105:33	And he struck their vineyards and their fig trees, and he crushed the trees of their region.
Psalm 105:34	He spoke, and the locust came forth, and the caterpillar, of which there was no number.
Psalm 105:35	And it devoured all the grass in their land, and it consumed all the fruit of their land.
Psalm 105:36	And he struck all the first-born in their land, the first-fruits of all their labor.
Psalm 105:37	And he led them out with silver and gold, and there was not an infirm one among their tribes.
Psalm 105:38	Egypt was joyful at their departure, for the fear of them lay heavy upon them.
Psalm 105:39	He spread a cloud for their protection, and a fire, to give them light through the night.
Psalm 105:40	They petitioned, and the quail came; and he satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
Psalm 105:41	He ruptured the rock and the waters flowed: rivers gushed in the dry land.
Psalm 105:42	For he had called to mind his holy word, which he kept near to his servant Abraham.
Psalm 105:43	And he led forth his people in exultation, and his elect in rejoicing.
Psalm 105:44	And he gave them the regions of the Gentiles, and they possessed the labors of the peoples,
Psalm 105:45	so that they might observe his justifications, and inquire about his law.
Psalm 106:1	Alleluia. Confess to the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy is with every generation.
Psalm 106:2	Who will declare the powers of the Lord? Who make a hearing for all his praises?
Psalm 106:3	Blessed are those who keep judgment and who do justice at all times.
Psalm 106:4	Remember us, O Lord, with good will for your people. Visit us with your salvation,
Psalm 106:5	so that we may see the goodness of your elect, so that we may rejoice in the joy of your nation, so that you may be praised along with your inheritance.
Psalm 106:6	We have sinned, as have our fathers. We have acted unjustly; we have wrought iniquity.
Psalm 106:7	Our fathers did not understand your miracles in Egypt. They did not remember the multitude of your mercies. And they provoked you, while going up to the sea, even the Red Sea.
Psalm 106:8	And he saved them for the sake of his name, so that he might make known his power.
Psalm 106:9	And he rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up. And he led them into the abyss, as if into a desert.
Psalm 106:10	And he saved them from the hand of those who hated them. And he redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
Psalm 106:11	And the water covered those who troubled them. Not one of them remained.
Psalm 106:12	And they believed his words, and they sang his praises.
Psalm 106:13	As soon as they had finished, they forgot his works, and they would not endure his counsel.
Psalm 106:14	And they coveted their desire in the desert, and they tempted God in a waterless place.
Psalm 106:15	And he granted to them their request, and he sent abundance into their souls.
Psalm 106:16	And they provoked Moses in the camp, and Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.
Psalm 106:17	The earth opened and swallowed Dathan, and it covered the congregation of Abiram.
Psalm 106:18	And a fire broke out in their congregation. A flame burned up the sinners.
Psalm 106:19	And they fashioned a calf at Horeb, and they adored a graven image.
Psalm 106:20	And they exchanged their glory for the likeness of a calf that eats hay.
Psalm 106:21	They forgot God, who saved them, who did great things in Egypt:
Psalm 106:22	miracles in the land of Ham, terrible things at the Red Sea.
Psalm 106:23	And he said that he would destroy them, yet Moses, his elect, stood firm before him in the breach, in order to avert his wrath, lest he destroy them.
Psalm 106:24	And they held the desirable land to be nothing. They did not trust in his word.
Psalm 106:25	And they murmured in their tabernacles. They did not heed the voice of the Lord.
Psalm 106:26	And he lifted up his hand over them, in order to prostrate them in the desert,
Psalm 106:27	and in order to cast their offspring among the nations, and to scatter them among the regions.
Psalm 106:28	And they were initiated into Baal of Peor, and they ate the sacrifices of the dead.
Psalm 106:29	And they provoked him with their inventions, and ruination was multiplied in them.
Psalm 106:30	Then Phinehas stood up and placated him: and so the violent disturbance ceased.
Psalm 106:31	And it was reputed to him unto justice, from generation to generation, even forever.
Psalm 106:32	And they provoked him at the Waters of Contradiction, and Moses was afflicted because of them,
Psalm 106:33	for they exasperated his spirit. And so he divided them with his lips.
Psalm 106:34	They did not destroy the nations, about which the Lord had spoken to them.
Psalm 106:35	And they were mixed among the Gentiles. And they learned their works,
Psalm 106:36	and they served their graven images, and it became a scandal to them.
Psalm 106:37	And they sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.
Psalm 106:38	And they shed innocent blood: the blood of their sons and of their daughters, which they sacrificed to the graven images of Canaan. And the land was infected with bloodshed,
Psalm 106:39	and was contaminated with their works. And they fornicated according to their own inventions.
Psalm 106:40	And the Lord became furiously angry with his people, and he abhorred his inheritance.
Psalm 106:41	And he delivered them into the hands of the nations. And those who hated them became rulers over them.
Psalm 106:42	And their enemies afflicted them, and they were humbled under their hands.
Psalm 106:43	Many times, he delivered them. Yet they provoked him with their counsel, and they were brought low by their iniquities.
Psalm 106:44	And he saw that they were in tribulation, and he heard their prayer.
Psalm 106:45	And he was mindful of his covenant, and he repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
Psalm 106:46	And he provided for them with mercies, in the sight of all those who had seized them.
Psalm 106:47	Save us, O Lord our God, and gather us from the nations, so that we may confess your holy name and glory in your praise.
Psalm 106:48	Blessed is the Lord God of Israel, from ages past, even to all ages. And let all the people say: Amen. Amen.
Psalm 107:1	Alleluia. Confess to the Lord, for he is good, for his mercy is with every generation.
Psalm 107:2	Let those who have been redeemed by the Lord say so: those whom he redeemed from the hand of the enemy and gathered from the regions,
Psalm 107:3	from the rising of the sun and its setting, from the north and from the sea.
Psalm 107:4	They wandered into solitude in a waterless place. They did not find the way of the city to be their dwelling place.
Psalm 107:5	They were hungry, and they were thirsty. Their soul fainted within them.
Psalm 107:6	And they cried out to the Lord in tribulation, and he rescued them in their necessity.
Psalm 107:7	And he led them in the right way, so that they might go forth to a city of habitation.
Psalm 107:8	Let his mercies confess to the Lord, and let his miracles confess to the sons of men.
Psalm 107:9	For he has satisfied the empty soul, and he has satisfied the hungry soul with good things:
Psalm 107:10	those sitting in darkness and in the shadow of death, shackled by extreme poverty and by iron.
Psalm 107:11	For they exasperated the eloquence of God, and they irritated the deliberation of the Most High.
Psalm 107:12	And their heart was brought low with hardships. They were weakened, and there was no one to help them.
Psalm 107:13	And they cried out to the Lord in their tribulation, and he freed them from their distress.
Psalm 107:14	And he led them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and he broke apart their chains.
Psalm 107:15	Let his mercies confess to the Lord, and let his miracles confess to the sons of men.
Psalm 107:16	For he has crushed the gates of brass and broken the iron bars.
Psalm 107:17	He has taken them up, from the way of their iniquity. For they were brought low, because of their injustices.
Psalm 107:18	Their soul abhorred all food, and they drew near even to the gates of death.
Psalm 107:19	And they cried out to the Lord in their tribulation, and he delivered them in their necessity.
Psalm 107:20	He sent his word, and he healed them, and he rescued them from their utter destruction.
Psalm 107:21	Let his mercies confess to the Lord, and let his miracles confess to the sons of men.
Psalm 107:22	And let them offer sacrifice with the sacrifice of praise, and let them announce his works in exultation.
Psalm 107:23	Those who descend to the sea in ships, making their livelihood in the great waters:
Psalm 107:24	these have seen the works of the Lord and his wonders in the deep.
Psalm 107:25	He spoke: and a windstorm stood up, and its waves were exalted.
Psalm 107:26	They ascend even to the heavens, and they descend even to the abyss. Their soul will waste away in distress.
Psalm 107:27	They were troubled, and they moved like a drunkard, and all their wisdom was consumed.
Psalm 107:28	And they cried out to the Lord in their tribulation, and he led them out of their distress.
Psalm 107:29	And he replaced the storm with a breeze, and its waves were stilled.
Psalm 107:30	And they were joyful that it was stilled, and he led them into the haven that they desired.
Psalm 107:31	Let his mercies confess to the Lord, and let his miracles confess to the sons of men.
Psalm 107:32	And let them exalt him in the Church of the people, and praise him in the chair of the elders.
Psalm 107:33	He has placed rivers in the desert and sources of water in dry places,
Psalm 107:34	a fruit-bearing land in the midst of brine, before the malice of those who dwell in it.
Psalm 107:35	He has placed a desert in the midst of pools of waters, and a land without water in the midst of sources of water.
Psalm 107:36	And he has gathered the hungry together there, and they constructed a city of habitation.
Psalm 107:37	And they sowed fields and planted vineyards, and they produced the fruit of nativity.
Psalm 107:38	And he blessed them, and they were multiplied exceedingly. And he did not diminish their beasts of burden.
Psalm 107:39	And they became few, and they were afflicted by the tribulation of evils and of sorrow.
Psalm 107:40	Contempt was poured over their leaders, and he caused them to wander in an impassable place, and not on the way.
Psalm 107:41	And he helped the poor out of destitution, and he stationed families like sheep.
Psalm 107:42	The upright will see, and they will rejoice. And every iniquity will block its mouth.
Psalm 107:43	Who is wise and will keep these things? And who will understand the mercies of the Lord?
